loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos, el esta siguiendo su carrera de Ciencias y Tecnología de Alimentos, quiere poder ayudar a las personas, es por ello que pone todo su esfuerzo. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar sus gastos de titulación.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de útiles, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Oscar is a person who strives to help his family and loved ones. He is studying for a career in Food Science and Technology, and wants to help people, which is why he puts all his effort into it. He mentions that through his previous loan he was able to pay for expenses related to his degree.

Today he once again asks for this loan to cover expenses related to equipment which will be helpful in continuing. He is grateful for this new opportunity that he has received.

loans.use: to pay for school equipment.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Сарвиноз проживает в городе Душанбе. Ей 31 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Муж занимается таксистом, он перевозить людей в городе. Сарвиноз серьезная и целеустремленная женщина. Она мастер швея. Сарвиноз у себя дома предоставляет услуги портнихи на заказ. Ей нравится сшить национальное платье, и ежедневный доход, который она трудится. Сарвиноз 8 лет двигается на этой виде деятельностью. Ей нужно купить новую машинку, чтоб увеличить свой доход. Так же на оставшуюся часть денег она потратит на покупки стройматериалов, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Сарвиноз обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Sarvinoz lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 31 years old, married and has children. Her husband is a taxi driver. He transports people around the city. Sarvinoz is a serious and purposeful woman. She is a seamstress. 

Sarvinoz provides a seamstress service from her home, taking orders. She likes to sew traditional dresses, and the daily income she gets when she works. She has advanced her business in this area for eight years. 

Sarvinoz needs to purchase a new sewing machine in order to increase her income. She will use the remaining part of the loan to purchase building materials in order to renovate her house. Sarvinoz applied for a loan due to insufficient personal financial resources.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and to purchase building materials

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: 28 летняя швея Гулноза. Она из района Рудаки. Гулноза замужем и мать двоих детей. Ее Муж добрый и заботливый мужчина. Он находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, чтобы зарабатывать и кормить семью. Дети маленькие и они ходят в садик. Гулноза тоже заботливая и талантливая женщина. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. У нее 8 летный опыт работы, и Гулноза хорошо знает свою работу. Ее доходы только от этой деятельностью. Гулнозе нужно купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы ускорить процесс работы и увеличить ежедневный доход. Она хочет купить новую современную электрическую швейную машинку и швейные принадлежности. Гулноза старается ради семьи. Поддержите ее финансовыми трудностями!
texts.en:
This 28 year old seamstress is Gulnoza. She is from the Rudaki region. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband is a good and loving man. He is a migrant worker in the Russian federation, where he earns money to feed his family. The children are young and in kindergarden. 

Gulnoza is also a loving and talented woman. She works with sewing women's clothing from her home. She has eight years of work experience. Gulnoza knows her work well. Her only income is from this business. 

Gulnoza needs to purchase a new sewing machine, in order to speed up the work process and increase her daily income. She would like to purchase a  modern electrical sewing machine and sewing accessories.

Gulnoza works hard for her family's happiness. Please help her with the financial difficulties!

loans.use: to purchase a modern electrical sewing machine and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio vive en la ciudad de Concepción, él se está esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida, y con sus estudios poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Comenta que está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, lucha para poder ser un profesional digno y útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y seguir con sus estudios como lo hace.
texts.en:
Emilio lives in the city of Concepcion, and is striving to become someone in life and with his studies to help his family and loved ones. He mentions that he is studying in an accounting career, and fights to be a worthy and useful professional to society.

He asks for this loan in order to pay his university dues and continue his studies as he is currently doing.

loans.use: to pay for university dues.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo esta estudiando la carrera que eligió y esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante, es una persona muy luchadora, y comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas, lo cual le fue muy útil y pudo estudiar.
Hoy nuevamente pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente la cuota de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios, agradece por la ayuda que recibe nuevamente.
texts.en:
Also is studying the university course that he chose and is giving it his best effort in order to be successful.  He is a hard-working person and says that he used his previous loan in order to pay his fees, which was very useful and he was able to study.

Now, he is again asking for a loan so that he can pay his course fees, and in this way be able to continue with his education. He is thankful for the help he again receives.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge  actualmente trabaja y de esa manera ayuda a sus padres y solventa sus gastos de estudios. Es una persona muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
Está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, y su deseo es recibirse, desenvolverse solo en su propio local para lograr su independencia económica.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jorge currently works and thus helps his parents and pays his education expenses. He is a very hard working person who wants to succeed.

He is studying systems analysis and his wish is to develop alone in his own shop in order to achieve economic independence.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his education fees and thus be able to continue his education as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay education fees.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y quiere poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su carrera.
Su meta es poder recibirse y ejercer su carrera para poder ayudar a las demás personas. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ricardo is from the city of Caaguazu. He is studying business administration and wants to be able to help his family through his course.

His goal to be able to receive and exercise his education to be able to help other people. He requests this loan to be able to pay his course fees and thus be able to continue his education.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Latinoamericanas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LATINOAMERICANAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betty es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de medias, confección y venta de trajes para damas, venta de ventanas, venta de coca, venta de papa
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Betty es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una asesora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace un año por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra arroz, fideo y papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Latinoamericanas" group will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Betty is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: selling vegetables, selling food, selling socks, making and selling women's clothing, selling windows, selling cocoa and selling potatoes.

The loan they will take will benefit the small businesses where Betty is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of an assessor of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. She began this business a year ago on her own initiative.

The loan that she will know take is to expand capital (to buy rice, noodle and potatoes at wholesale) that she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later make and sell from her sales space. This type of work allows her to earn income to support her family economically since she lives with her partner and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds the area of health the the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Divinas Fortalezas Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIVINAS FORTALEZAS II” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, servicio de internet, venta de mantas, venta de CD, venta de mantillas, venta de jugos de frutas, venta de libros, venta de polainas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria  indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de internet; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace cuatro años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una impresora que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz. Esta compra le ayudara a tener más ingresos en su negocio.
Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Divinas Fortalezas II community group will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Maria is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: selling furniture, internet service, selling blankets, selling CDs, selling shawls, selling fruit juice, selling books, selling leggings.

The loan that they will take will benefit the small businesses. Maria tells us that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has an internet service business. She began this business four years ago.

The loan that she will now take will be to buy a printer that she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. This purchase will help her have more income in her business.

This form of work allows her to earn income to support her family economically since she is married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru:
Девушка с прекрасной улыбкой на фотографии это Нодира. Она веселая, умная и гостеприимная девушка. Нодира много лет назад выбрала себе швейную деятельность. Потому что это не легкая деятельность, которая приносит ей много прибыль.  Нодира шьет одно обычное платье за 40 TJS, а платье с вышивкой за 110 TJS. 
Нодире 25 лет. Она не замужем. Нодира в районе Файзабад живет вместе родителям. Она просит кредит, чтобы купит швейную машинку марки «YAMATA». Новая швейная машинка поможет ей расширить деятельность, и она сможет сшить больше платье. Нодира верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
The young lady with the wonderful smile in the photograph is called Nodira. She is a cheerful, clever and hospitable young lady. Nomira chose to sew as a business many years ago because it is difficult work that brings her a lot of profits. Nodira sews an ordinary dress for 40 TJS [Tajikistani somoni], and an embroidered dress for 110 TJS.

Nodira is 25 years old. She is unmarried. Nodira lives with her parents in the Fayzabad region. She is asking for a loan in order to buy a new Yamata brand sewing machine. A new sewing machine will help her to expand her business, and she will be able to sew more dresses. Nodira believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to buy a new Yamata brand sewing machine.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда молодая жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей всего 21 лет. Она добрая, вежливая, красивая и активная девушка. У нее высшая образования. Мавчуда проживает с мамой и отцом. Она дома занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды на заказ. 5 лет назад Мавчуда научила кроить и шить женскую одежду, ей этому делу было не нелегко, она быстро освоила все навыки, чтобы скорее начать зарабатывать и улучшить финансовое состояние семьи. У Мавчуды сначала было мало клиентов, но постепенно к ней начали приходить всё больше и больше клиентов. Мавчуда обратилась за кредитом для приобретения новой швейной машинки. Из-за того что ее нынешняя машинка не выполняет свои функции как прежде хорошо она решила купить новую, чтобы продолжить работу и сохранить источник дохода.
texts.en:
Mavjuda is a young resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is just 21 years old. She is a kind, polite, beautiful and active young lady. She has a higher education. Mavjuda lives with her mother and father. She sews national women's clothing to order at home. Mavjuda began cutting and sewing women's clothing five years ago. It was hard for her but she quickly mastered all the skills to start earning and to improve the financial status of her family. At first Mavjuda had few clients, but gradually more and more clients began coming to her.

Mavjuda has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine because her current one does not function as well as it did before. She has decided to buy a new one in order to continue working and to preserve her source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Luz Andina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ ANDINA” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapa, venta de chompa, venta de comida, venta de autos, venta de verduras, venta de cosméticos.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paola es integrante, ella indica que es hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá desde hace varios años. 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y salchicha  por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo elaborará y lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
Communal bank Luz Andina ('Light of the Andes') is in its ninth lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focus group of Santiago II.
It is comprised of eight members, with Paola as president.
The members are engaged in various activities, such as: selling street food, selling clothes, selling food, selling cars, selling vegetables, and selling cosmetics.
Loans to the group benefit small women entrepreneurs; it is now Paola's turn.
She tells us that she has been with Pro Mujer for three years and that she learned about the institution thanks to a friend, who was already a member of a group.
Lorena sells salchipapa, a street food made of sausages and potatoes.
She says she learned the trade from her mother several years ago.
She will use the loan to increase her working capital by buying ingredients (potatoes and sausages) wholesale from sellers in the town of El Alto, which she will then use for her work, selling the resulting product at her stall.
Her business is her sole source of income, necessary to support her family, since she is single.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she mentions the information about health and the training courses dispensed by the institution.

loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Moko Sane Moko Sane Group

texts.en:
Ivy is continuing with her business selling cooking oil at the market. She is the first person from the left in the photo. She invested the previous loan she received in the purchase of assorted cooking oils to sell to customers.

She, together with her colleagues, works with ID Ghana to continue their daily business activities, which are selling cooking oil, fresh and smoked fish and general goods.

Her business and income have improved at the same time as her needs have grown. Her business's advantage is that she sells every day. 

Her dream is to open more joints to supply customers. 

She wishes to purchase more of the cooking oil to be able to satisfy her customers. 

She is in her 11th loan sequence with the institution in the 17 years she has been doing this work. These are the reasons Ivy is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil and sell to customers: by so doing she can make enough profit and take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to sell to customers.

loans.name: Dromo Naa Group

texts.en:
Leticia is a 39-year-old married woman and has two dependent children. Her business is selling groceries. She is a good mother and an entrepreneur. She is also independent, generous, patient, responsible, and hardworking. Leticia has a chocolate complexion and long black hair.  She is wearing African design fabric and is standing second from the right at the back in the photo. Leticia speaks a bit of English and her local language called Ga. She shares her life with her husband, who works, and her dependent children who are schooling. They live in their family house, built of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof and brick floor. At home, they have drinking water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Due to her need to continue with her business, Leticia decided to join a group of people with businesses such as selling groceries, maize, groundnuts, soft drinks, secondhand clothing, and tea and bread, in order to request a loan and improve her activities. Leticia's business is selling groceries such as milk, Milo, tea bags, sugar, etc., which she does from a stall at her residence.  Her dream is to open a big place for selling groceries in order to serve more customers. 

The members of this group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To  buy groceries (such as milk, Milo, tea bags, sugar, etc.) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, a 62-year-old widow and resident of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. No matter how hard life is in the Philippines, by God's grace and her faith Myrna has been able to send her children to school and they are now all working. Being an in independent woman, she has her own business to provide for her needs.

Myrna operates a business buying and reselling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes. She buys RTW clothes from a wholesaler and sells them at retail prices. Customers are attracted to buy from her due to her low prices and the many options she offers. Her neighbors and the local community patronize her business and encourage her carry on with life since her husband died. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Myrna trusts God and your good heart to lend her PHP 19,000, which she will use to buy RTW merchandise such as different styles of apparel for women, men, and children. There is higher demand for her items as the school year has started in the Philippines. She thanks God and you, in advance, for granting her request for it will surely help grow her business and her earnings are a great help for her daily sustenance.

Myrna hopes and prays to God to prosper in her business and lead a better life. She prays that one of her offspring will be healed from his illness. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear clothes such as polo shirts, pants, t-shirts, as well as DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 30 years old and he lives in the frontier village of Azatamut in the Tavush region. He lives in this nice village with his young wife and already three children. Edgar does his best to support his young and big family with good living conditions. 

He has a track on which he gives cargo services and simultaneously he runs farming. His farm is still a cute one but he is sure he will make it bigger and richer. Edgar has two cows and two calves. On his plot of land Edgar cultivates potatoes, beans and tomatoes. Edgar sells all his farm products little by little at the city wholesale market. Edgar also has new ideas which are also a very good chance to earn more money for his family. 

With this loan amount he wants to buy a tractor which he will use both at his farm and he will also take orders for work on it at his villagers’ farms.

loans.use: to buy a tractor which he will use both at his farm and he will also take orders for work on it at his villagers’ farms

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a 59-year-old IDP. She is a married and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. The husband helps his wife earning money as a laborer. Fatma is raising fruits and vegetables in her garden and sells them at a local bazaar. That is Fatma’s business, and she has working in this area for 25 years. Her monthly income is 230AZN.

People prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper.  People know that such products are always fresh and healthy; they are not grown with different pesticides and not harmful. During long years of experience, Fatma was taught how to cover customer`s demands.  So, selling fruits and vegetables from houses is popular and cheaper for people to buy them in bazaars than in big markets.

Her income doesn’t allow covering all the demands. She is planning to expand her garden and grow more seasonal fruits and vegetables. 

Fatma wants her sons to get married and have a good life. She applied for 1,500AZN.

loans.use: to expand her garden and grow more seasonal fruits

loans.name: Hicran

texts.en:
Hicran is 42 years old, married, and mother of 2 kids. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as pomegranates, queen-apples, pears and cherries. In the summer she raises fruits and in the autumn and winter she raises vegetables such as potatoes, pumpkins and carrots. Hicran 's monthly income is 180 AZN. 

She usually sells her crops to the local market vendors. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made with vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijani family's table and also used to make fresh punch.  Her husband  helps her a lot in raising her crops. 

Hicran applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy more seeds and fertilizer. This will be her first loan.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mujeres Obreras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES OBRERAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mochilas, venta de fruta, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de artefactos, venta de accesorios de celular, venta de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo  aprendió de su mamá desde hace veinte años.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Communal bank Mujeres Obreras ('Women workers') is in its third lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focus group of Los Andes.
It is comprised of nine members, with Lourdes as president.
The members are engaged in various activities, such as: selling backpacks, selling fruit, selling traditional clothing, selling food, selling electronics, selling accessories, and providing transport services.
Loans to the group benefit small women entrepreneurs; it is now Lourdes's turn.
She tells us that she has been with Pro Mujer for four years and that she learned about the institution thanks to a friend, who was already a member of a group.
Lourdes sells traditional clothing. She says she learned the trade from her mother some twenty years ago.
She will use the loan to increase her working capital by buying wool wholesale from sellers in La Paz, which she will then use for her work, selling the resulting product at her shop.
Her business is her sole source of income, necessary to support her family, since she is single and has three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she mentions the information about health dispensed by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lorena es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de puertas de madera, venta de comida, venta de zapatos, venta de muebles, venta de jugos de fruta y venta de  cosméticos. 
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lorena es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al trabajar como ayudante de cocina, con el pasar del tiempo y con unos ahorros decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa, chuño y  tunta por mayor) que adquirirá de las comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
Communal bank Renacer ('Rebirth') is in its first lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focus group of Cascada.
It is comprised of eight members, with Lorena as secretary.
The members are engaged in various activities, such as: selling food, selling wooden doors, selling shoes, selling furniture, selling fruit juice, and selling cosmetics.
Loans to the group benefit small women entrepreneurs; it is now Lorena's turn.
She tells us that she learned about the institution thanks to a friend, who was already a member of a group.
Lorena sells food. She says she learned the trade when she was working as a cook's assistant, and that after some time, she decided to use her savings to set up her own business.
She will use the loan to increase her working capital by buying ingredients (various types of potatoes, both dried and fresh) wholesale from sellers in the town of El Alto, which she will then use for her work, selling the resulting product at her stall.
Her business is her sole source of income, necessary to support her family, since she is single and has three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she mentions the training courses given by the institution.

loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Alva

texts.en:
Alva is 52 years old, married, and a refugee. He has two children. His wife is a teacher. 

He grows and sells fruits (apples, oranges, pears, lemons, bananas, etc.) and vegetables (greens, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions and so on) at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 190 AZN. Alva's elder son helps him to grow fruits and vegetables.

Azeri people like eating delicious and fresh vegetables. Besides that, vegetables are used in preparing different soups (tomato soup, lentil soup), salads, national dishes such as roasted eggplant, etc. Demand for fruit is also high. People use fruits to make fresh juice, fruit pies, and different sorts of jam.

He wants to expand his business and improve his family's life condition. Therefore, he applied for a 1,200 AZN loan. He will use this money to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Qaratel

texts.en:
Qaratel is 61 year old, married, and mother of 4 kids.  All of her kids are married and live separately.  Qaratel is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in Bilasuvar, Azerbaijan.  Qaratel is a tailor but her salary is not sufficient to cover family needs, and because of that she has also worked in agriculture, specifically growing crops and animal husbandry.  She is the only breadwinner in family because her husband very old and ill.  

Qaratel is a very kind and responsible woman, very social, and hardworking.  She has four milking cows with calves, and her fresh milk and dairy products are in great demand among local residents to whom she sells.  Her customer base increases every day and therefore Qaratel has decided to develop her business.  She has turned to Aqroinvest Credit Union for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers and two milking cows.  She plans to build a big barn with profits from the loan, and to start building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and two milking cows.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 28-year-old married mother of two who established in May 2014 her own children's clothes shop to help her husband, who traveled abroad seeking a better work opportunity to cover their family's expenses and improve their living.

Diana is a hard worker who has proved within this short time that she has remarkable customer service talents. She is trying hard to develop her business.

Today, she is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a newly released summer collection, especially for the end of holy month of Ramadan celebrations. SHe also wants to open a beauty salon section.
 
Diana hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new summer clothes and to open a beauty salon section.

loans.name: Tupendane Kongowe Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, a mother of two daughters who are grown up, is in her late 40s. She is married. 

For 18 years now, she has had a cafeteria, serving food to people. She prepares varieties of foods that attract many people. She works from 5 a.m. to midnight. She is a hardworking woman. Fatuma is able to earn a fair monthly profit.

This is her 15th credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Fatuma is a long-time Tujijenge customer who repays her credits well. With her previous credits, she upgraded her premise with tables and chairs, plates, glasses, and cooking ingredients such as cooking oil, maize and baking flour, sugar, kilos of meat and fishes. Tujijenge is so happy to see Fatuma improve month after month, and this enabled her to receive some extra income that she used to cover family living costs and plow back into her cafeteria.

In the coming years, Fatuma would like to own a big hotel serving varieties of foods. 

With this credit request, she will buy cooking ingredients for her cafeteria. She will share this credit with her group, Tupendane Kongowe, totaling four members. The group members will hold each other accou8ntable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her cafeteria .

loans.name: Aviner

texts.en: Aviner lives with his wife in the frontier village of Khashtarak, in the Tavush region. They both are engaged in farming and agricultural activities. This is their beloved occupation and also their only source of income. In his farm Aviner has a cow, a calf, a pig, bee families and also chickens. His plot of land gives them vegetables both for their everyday use and for sale as well. Aviner manages to sell potatoes, beans, cabbage, tomatoes and greens from his farm. He also has a nice orchard with the sweetest harvest of apricots and apples. Aviner greatly wants to develop swine breeding in his farm and he greatly hopes that he will manage it with the help of this Kiva loan. With this loan Aviner wants to buy several piglets and also some fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and also some fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 54 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Batumi district. 

Liana is unemployed at the moment. The only source of income is her husband's salary for the family. Liana owns a flat, which need to be renovated. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to renovate a flat. 

As the flat is renovated she will rent it out and will get income.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to get income

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a 40-year-old farmer from Gitareni Village, Kenya, working in dairy farming.  Her work brings home an important source of income.  Celia is married and has 4 children, the oldest being 19.  Besides dairy farming, Celia also raises poultry, crops, and farms trees.

Celia applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm.  She seeks to buy additional dairy goats with the loan in order to increase the quantity of milk that she supplies to the market.  The impact of your lending will be the growth of Celia's customer base and monthly income.  Celia needs additional income to take care of her increasing family expenses, which is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds to help him to pay school fees

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 28-year-old single woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small house. 

Sana started her own business one year ago, which is a chicken barn. She sells products in the local market.

Sana took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more chickens for her barn. This will increase productivity and income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for her barn.

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en:
Yasmine is a 21-year-old single woman living with her parents.

Her father is the main income provider in the family. He works as an employee in a local company but he earns a barely sufficient income. That’s why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to be able to pay her technical school educational fees.

Yasmine is very eager to make use of the loan as her only purpose is to get an education to be competitive with others and to reach higher positions in her professional career.

loans.use: to pay her technical school educational fees

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan is 32 years old and he lives with his brother in Gavar city of Gegharkunik region. Vachagan’s parents are in the Russian Federation and working there; they send money for their sons’ needs. While Vachagan, with the help of his brother, takes care of their cute farm, where he has five cows, three calves and two heifers. 

Vachagan likes his farm work, and he manages to have some assortment from the farm for sale, as well. He sells milk and meat right from his farm to his regular customers. He also manages to have income from his land’s potato sales. 

Vachagan has great ideas connected with his farm and the most important among them is his farm enlargement; with this loan amount he will buy cows and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy goats

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is a businessman. For over 20 years he has been engaged in a trading business at his city's wholesale market, where he sells women's shoes and bags. He works at a rented stall. He says he has made great efforts to attract more and more customers with polite service and not high prices, and this helped him to keep his business, even in periods of financial crisis, when it seemed he would lose it. 

Ashot is married and he lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region with his wife, who works at the pharmacy, and his son, who is 23 years old and greatly helps his father in their business activities. 

With this Kiva loan, Ashot wants to repair the shelves on which he shows the assortment of shoes for sale, and he will also buy some new assortment of sport shoes for women.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of sport shoes for women and to repair the shelves on which he shows the assortment of shoes.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is a 24-year-old married woman, and she has a one-year-old daughter. She never went to school because of her parents' financial situation and the war. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region. They are living in hard conditions; because of that she is working every day without rest. Tahmina works growing fruits and vegetables. She learned this from her father. This has allowed her to move her family ahead. Tahmina's day starts at 6:00 a.m. because she wakes up very early to milk a cow. 

Tahmina is requesting a loan from Aqroinvest Credit Union to buy seed, manure and poison. Her dream for the future is to see her child graduate with a college career because she was not able to do it. Please support Tahmina.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure and poison for her business growing fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 28-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband and one child. She is a housewife where she is dedicated to her home and family. Her husband works in the Lebanese army and he is the main income provider. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; she will be utilizing the loan to pay her child's educational fees.  She said that this loan will surely helped her to insure the school year for her child, which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep to resell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Hi there lenders! 

Thanks for being a part of Conchita's journey. With your previous financial support, she did establish her direct selling business, resulting in a more profitable source of income. 

She has been dedicated and passionate in cultivating her business. Though her journey with this is not as smooth as she dreams, she keeps her perspective and her will to improve her family's state. 

She has been looking forward to more opportunities to grow her inventory, and once more, she would like to ask your help. She is borrowing a PHP 8,000 loan for quantities of merchandise to sell like shampoos, colognes, soaps, fabrics and other personal products.  

She has proven once that she's faithful in repaying, and she hopes that you trust her once again. With hope and faith, she believes that through this, she'll be able to earn well for her children's education. She wants them to finish school for future security. She also wants to operate her own sari-sari store someday. 

As of today, she's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push towards the goal through the religion that she studies with her colleagues. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 39 years old and he lives in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. He is married and he has a son. For some time Gagik used to work at the car repairing garage as a mechanic, but now he is busy only with farming and agriculture. In his farm now he has cows, a calf and chickens. His plot of land is also of great use for his family. On it he cultivates potato, tomato, cucumber, pepper, onion and greens. These all go both for family use and also for sale. His farm’s milk and eggs together with vegetables Gagik sells at the city wholesale market. 

He would like to enlarge his potato production which will also make bigger his family income. With this Kiva loan Gagik wants to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Zhirayr

texts.en:
Zhirayr, in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region, lives with his wife and owns a farm, which is the main source of income for their living. Zhirayr also works as a driver, but the main part of the day he devotes to farming and its development. 

On his farm he has cows, calves, a bull, sheep, lambs and a pig. With the help of his wife they have a great assortment of farm products for sale, such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, butter and meat. The sale of meat Zhirayr organizes through some re-sellers and also he sells it to his city butchers. He mentions that meat sale is rather profitable and he plans to develop it. 

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Zhirayr would like to spend on the purchase of one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Ferda

texts.en:
Ferda is a young entrepreneur of age 29. After graduating from the university she opened a beauty saloon.  

With the help of the loan she made brochures of her salon for promotion and bought facial beauty products in bulk.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Ferda hanım 29 yaşında genç bir girişimci.  Üniversiteyi bitirdikten sonra kendi işletmesini açmaya karar vermiş ve bir güzellik salonu işletmeye başlamış.  Mayadan aldığı kredi ile güzellik salonunun reklamı için broşür bastırdı ve toptan yüz bakım ürünleri aldı.

loans.use: to buy facial beauty products

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a progressive smallholder farmer based in the Thika area of Kenya. She is married and has 4 children. She relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of her family. If you were to visit her 1.5 acre farm today, you will find one dairy cow, five chickens, and about sixty trees, most of which produce bananas.

Irene is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, through Juhudi Kilimo, to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle that will be used for transporting goods to and from the market. With this asset, Irene will be able to have access to formal markets in new geographical and economic regions where prices are much better than the local markets.

Increase in income from this intervention will help Irene to scale up her business and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for farm transportation

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en:
Hrayr is 37 years old and  he lives in Kapan city in Syunik region with his nice wife, two sons and his retired mother.

Hrayr has a vocational education in auto mechanics and from 1999 until today he works at his specialty, particularly on an abrasive machine. Hrayr does polishing of car engine components. He has a lot of customers not only from Kapan city but also from the whole Syunik region.

Since Hrayr is the only bread-winner in his family, he works a lot until late at night and without holidays so that he never loses any order or customer who needs his service. So, this loan is very important for Hrayr and his occupation as he must buy special stone for his abrasive machine so as to work quickly and with better quality.

loans.use: to buy special stone for his abrasive machine, so as to work quickly and with better quality

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is married and has one child.  She attended sewing end embroidery courses that were given by the municipality.  She wanted to make money out of  the things she had learned and make a contribution to the family budget.  With the help of the loan she bought fabrics.  She made bed sheets, tablecloths and kitchen towels, sold them to her neighbours and made money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Zeynep hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Belediyenin açmış olduğu dikiş nakış kurslarına giderek bu mesleği öğrenmiş.  Ev ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için öğrendiği bu mesleği ticarete çevirmeye karar vermiş.  Mikro kredi kullanarak kendisine toptan pikelik kumaş aldı.  Çeyizlik pike takımları ve mutfak takımları yaparak çevresine satmaya ve para kazanmaya başladı.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing into household items

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 52 years old and has four children, ages 23, 21, 17 and 15. Her husband works as in maintenance at a company with a low salary that most of the time does not meet their daily needs. In order to help her husband, Maria Fe took a job as a rice dealer which helps with their expenses, but Maria Fe wants to save for her children's education. She wanted to have her own business in dealing rice to increase her income for her children's schooling.

Maria Fe has been with SEED for three years. She took a loan to open her rice dealing business and, over time, Maria Fe's business improved from delivering rice to just her neighbors to delivering rice to her community. Maria Fe now is earning a net income of PHP 2,000 daily and more customers are ordering rice from her because of her low prices.

Maria Fe is now requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy 20 sacks of rice to sell to her customers. She is confident that with the loan she will be able to meet her customers' demand and thus increase her income, as well as get more regular customers.

Maria Fe wants to have her own rice store and stock house someday so she can continue to support her children's education and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nalan

texts.en:
Nalan is married and has one child.  In winters she is knitting berets and in summers she is making backpacks out of felt and fabric.  With the help of the loan she is planning to buy felt and fabric.  She is going to make more bags, sell them and make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nalan hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Kışın örgü işi bere.  Yazında keçe ve kumaştan çanta dikerek satıyor.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile keçe ve kumaş alarak.  Çanta yapacak satarak para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy felt and fabric to make into backpacks for kids

loans.name: Radu

texts.en:
Radu, 38-year old man, married, who stared his own business working with livestock and dairy production. It all began when a calf was purchased for the family and the over time a business was born. At the moment Radu has two dairy cows, one calf and nine pigs. The milk from the cows is sold, giving the family a stable monthly income and the pigs are raised for one year and then sold at the market. To feed and ensure a good diet for his animals and to also have a second income, he cultivates four and a half hecatres of land, with one and a half hectares being alfalfa, two hectares being soybeans and one hectare of pumpkins. 

All of the land is processed with his own tractor and he also owns a milking machine to help him with his work. Radu has the opportunity to expand his business and would like to purchase three more cows and another hectare of agricultural land. This loan will enable him to increase his milk production, which will bring in more revenue so that he can support his family and continue to develop his business.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of cows and land which will expand milk production and increase revenue for the family

loans.name: Filiz

texts.en:
Filiz is married and has one child.  After marriage heard about sales from network business (health and diet products). She became a representative in order to support her husband financially.  Shr worked for years in this business, now she considers herself as a professional and works as one.  With the help of the loan she bought bulks of products with good price.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Filiz Hanım evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  Evlendikten sonra network (sağlık ürünleri zayıflama vs.) işi ile tanışmış.  Eşine destek olmak amacıyla oda bu işe girmiş.  Yıllardır bu işi yapan Filiz hanım bu işte ustalaştığını ek gelir olarak gördüğü bu işi artık profesyonel olarak yapmaya başlamış.  Mayadan aldığı kredi ile ürünlerini toptan ve daha ucuza aldı.

loans.use: to buy health and diet products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to  buy paper and glue for her business making envelopes.

loans.name: Valida

texts.en: Valida is 44 years old and married with two children. She is engaged in selling milk, and has three cows. Valida and her husband are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) and they live in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. The income her business generates is about 200 AZN per month, but it is too low to cover the basic demands of her family. Milk and dairy products are very popular in Azerbaijan, and that is why Valida has decided to purchase an additional cow and calf. Additional livestock will help Valida to meet customer demand, increase her income, and thereby improve the living conditions of her family. Her loan request is 1,500 AZN. Please support Valida.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow and calf.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana comenta que le inspiran a alcanzar sus metas el poder ayudar a sus padres que siempre le apoyan en todo, a seguir estudiando y a recibirse como profesional.
Está estudiando la carrera de docente, para ser maestro y ayudar a las personas que quieran ser alguien en la vida. Su meta futura es recibirse de docente y seguir progresando día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Juana says that what inspires her to reach her goals is being able to help her parents who have always supported her in everything, to continue studying, and to be received as a professional.

She is studying teaching in order to become a teacher and to help people who want to become someone in life.  Her future goal is to graduate from teaching and continue progressing day to day.

She asks for this loan so that she can pay the fees for her university course and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new fashionable clothes to resell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is truly grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which helped grow her coconut-selling business. Her earnings covered her family's daily sustenance.

Justina is a "buko" dealer (coconut dealer). Although life has not been easy for her, she maintains a positive attitude and her faith in God drives her to persevere and be joyful in life. Her family has been her source of inspiration to continue to work and see her grandchildren grow.

She trusts that she will be granted another 50,000 PHP loan to purchase more sacks of coconut to sell. Coconut meat and juice is among the favorite fruits of Filipinos for its flavor and nutritious value. She already has regular buyers at their town market aside from the individuals who buy from her along the road. 

She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Justina to buy a new delivery truck to easily transport coconut to the public market. She prays that God will continue to bless her family and continue to prosper her business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more buko and to pay for the maintenance of the truck used to deliver buko to dealers and regular customers.

loans.name: Rouba

texts.en:
Rouba is a 42 year old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is an employee in a company. She, together with her husband are always ready to meet their children’s demands and fulfill their family needs.

Today, in order to pay her children's school fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay for the educational fees and ensure a suitable educational path for her children.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 52 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and six children, two of whom are still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time. As for her husband, he is the main income provider in the family. He owns a restaurant and also works as a contractor in vocational education to help his beloved family live in good conditions.

Today, Lina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school. The parents only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Thank you lenders! You are such a great help to Olivia. What you have lent her recently was able to help her in providing for the daily expenses of her household and developing her business (a sari-sari store).   

As her business expands, she would like to take out another loan worth PHP 50,000. She would use this to buy additional products to sell like groceries.  

Someday, she hopes for a better life for her children. She prays for continuous increase in her profit and for additional branches for her business in the future.  

Olivia meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the religion she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items needed for her store.

loans.name: Venice

texts.en:
Venice is a 34-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Venice has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years.

Venice requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a progressive smallholder farmer based in the Thika area of Kenya. She is married and has 5 children. She relies on livestock and crop farming for a living. If you were to visit her 1 acre farm today, you will find 3 dairy cows, 20 chickens, fodder and about 100 trees.

Jane is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, through Juhudi Kilimo, to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle that will be used for transporting goods to and from the market. With this asset, Jane will be able to have access to formal markets in new geographical and economic regions where prices are much better than the local markets.

Increase in income from this intervention will help Jane to scale up her business and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nejla

texts.en:
Nejla is married and a mother of three.  Together with her husband she is selling baby clothings.  Her husband makes the sales while Nejla makes them in their workshop.  She used loan for three times, she bought fabric and made baby wear, pyjamas and sweat panties and shirts, sold them and made money.  With the help of the loan she is planning to buy more fabric, make more products and gain more money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nejla hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Eşi ile beraber çocuk giysileri satışı yapıyor.  Eşi dükkanda satıyor Nejla hanım da atölyede dikerek, üretim yapıyor.  Aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı, kumaş aldı, çocuk giysileri pijama ve eşofman üretti ve sattı para kazandı.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile kumaş alarak ürünler üreterek satışlarını artırmayı ve işini geliştirmeyi planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy fabric for hand made baby clothing for sale

loans.name: Twiyubake Cb Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a group leader; aged 37 years.She is married with 6 children aged between 4 and 17 years. The group is called TWIYUBAKE means “SOLIDARITY” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She has a shop and has been running in a business for 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Adinai

texts.ru: Адинай, 25 лет, не замужем, детей нет, живет с мамой и сестрой. Образование среднее. 5 лет назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством - животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. На 0,65 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу, морковь и перец для реализации. Также есть яблоневый сад. Ежемесячная прибыль Адинай составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). Она решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 телят. Доходы от бизнеса Адинай будет вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие, чтобы накопить на постройку кухни в доме.
texts.en:
Adinai is 25 years old. She is not married and does not have any children. She lives with her mother and her sister. She has a high school education. 

Five years ago, Adinai started working with agriculture: Livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. She has three cows on her farm. On 0.65 hectares of land she grows sweet corn, carrots and peppers for selling. She also has an apple garden. Adinai's monthly income is around 18,000 som (KGS).

Adinai decided to develop her agricultural business, and turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase four calves. She will invest the income from the business in developing it further, in order to save money for building a kitchen in her house.

loans.use: to purchase four calves for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 56 years old and married with two children. She works in agriculture, in the pig-fattening business, in the Philippines. Valentina requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Valentina has been in pig fattening for five years now. To sustain her business, she has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past.

In the future, Valentina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Analyn has been running a general store for two years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Analyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, soft drinks, juice, etc. to sell. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. Analyn aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, soft drinks, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Shelia

texts.en:
Shelia is a strong woman who has worked very hard to support her two children and provide the best life she possibly could for them as a single mother. Shelia was able to purchase a small modest home for herself and her children in 1997 and has managed to maintain the household on her own. Shelia has experienced some setbacks that have caused financial distress for her family. She was diagnosed with a medical condition that causes her excruciating pain, and so she has been unable to work. Despite her financial hardships, she is very close to paying off her mortgage and will then own her home free and clear. Shelia’s mortgage is the only debt she incurred; she does not use credit cards and will only seek financing when absolutely necessary. 

Shelia has managed to maintain her home through the years; however, she desperately needs repairs to her roof. She has been very worried about the condition of the roof on her home because it is missing some shingles and has several leaks. Shelia loves her home, which is located close to her extended family, and she plans to live in the home for the rest of her life. Shelia is hoping that Solar and Energy Loan Fund (SELF) and Kiva can help her pay for a roof repair, which will eliminate mold growth due to water penetrating the drywall in her home. This will give Shelia peace of mind that her roof will not collapse on her due to the structure rotting. Not only will Shelia receive the necessary repairs to her roof, but she will also build a credit history as she repays her loan. 

Shelia will use her Kiva loan to pay for necessary roof repairs to stop rain water from leaking into her home and to repair any structural damage.

loans.use: to pay for necessary roof repairs to stop rain water from leaking into her home and to repair any structural damage.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 34 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school. Virgilia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Virgilia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for nine years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sidwell

texts.en:
Sidwell is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: 

1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration. I enjoy mathematics classes the most. I enjoy the Financial Management class most because I get to learn how to run a business, bearing in mind the expenses to be incurred in order to generate income. With the background of the above mentioned, I can plan a strategy accordingly in order to be effective and efficient. 

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? In which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
I want to start my own consulting business in Johannesburg. I would like to travel. I would like to work in Johannesburg, however I am open to travelling and exploring other fields, as my mind is not fixed on a particular genre or sector. I was born in Pretoria and moved to Johannesburg 15 years ago in search of opportunities. For most of those years I found myself wondering and battling to survive, forced by circumstances to settle for odd jobs. When I heard about the Maharishi Institute I jumped in excitement. An opportunity I have longed for: to be educated. As things stand, I am struggling to cover living costs, including accommodation and my travels to and from the Institute. This is because I don't have a guardian or parent looking after me. On the contrary, I am the one that needs to feed two children and their mother, yet I am a student.

3.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
In my spare time I like to read novels, play soccer, or watch television. I work at night, so I don't really have spare time. I knock off at 2:00, go to bed around 3:00, and then I have to wake up at 5:30 to prepare for school, which starts at 8:00. I try so hard to sell the artworks I produce. However that is very difficult to achieve considering our economy.

4.	How will a Kiva loan change your life? 
A Kiva loan will help me to invest most of my time towards my studies, rather than dividing my attention between studies and hustling to earn income. If granted this loan, I will not go to sleep late anymore, and therefore will be able to concentrate in class and not fall asleep during the lectures.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has been doing mixed farming for the past two years and has grown her farm business tremendously. She has four diary cows, seven heads of poultry, 200 trees, and a horticultural farm that produces food crops. Eunice was raised in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, where she now lives with her husband and two children and conducts her business. 

Currently, Eunice is trying to gather capital to secure more land to cultivate and produce more food that will give her family a decent diet and better income. She loves to feed people and that is why she finds her business fulfilling. Your loan will help her elevate her livelihood by producing more food for her family and others in the community.

loans.use: to secure rental land

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is a 23-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her child in the Morogoro district. She is requesting a loan in order to launch her clothing business. She plans to use the profit she earns to pay for her child's school fees. Farida also volunteers as a Learner Guide, leading life-skills sessions for students in the nearby high school. She focuses on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. Farida’s dream is to enroll in a teacher training program within the next two years.

loans.use: to launch her clothing business.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fatima está integrado  por  18 mujeres, está en  el ciclo 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan  a poder salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras y trabajadoras que están poniendo todo de si para poder crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Feliciana, quien trabaja y se esfuerza para poder crecer y salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de los ingresos que obtenga y darles una vida digna y honesta. Ella se dedica a las costuras,  y hace todo tipo de confecciones, como ser prendas, sabanas, cortinas y otros.
Feliciana pide este préstamo para poder crecer e invertir en su emprendimiento y comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group Virgen de Fatima, made up of eighteen women, are in their twelfth cycle of the committee of women program, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are very hardworking with a fighting spirit, and give their all so they will be able to grow. 
One of the members is Feliciana, she works hard to get ahead so she can help her loved ones with the income she earns and give them a dignified, honest life. She works in sewing, and makes all kinds of things like items of clothing, sheets, curtains and more. 
Feliciana is requesting this loan to grow her business and invest in fabrics, threads, elastic and other supplies, so she can continue with her sewing as she has been doing. They are all grateful for the opportunity they are being given to grow and better themselves.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastic and more to use in sewing

loans.name: Nabonswende 2Pikioko Group

texts.fr:
M. SOULEYMANE est responsable du groupe  NABONSWENDE 2PIKIOKO. Marié il père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 15 mois. 04 des enfants vont à l’école et il a 09 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’agriculture et l’élevage depuis plus de 25 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 10 sacs d’engrais, 05 bidons de 20 litres d’essence et 07 boites d’insecticides. 
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité, payer la scolarité de ses enfants et épargner. Il ambitionne payer une parcelle.
texts.en: Souleymane is the leader of the Nabonswende 2 Pikioko Group. He is a married father to five children; his eldest is 20 years old and his youngest is 15 months old. Four of his children currently attend school and he has nine people living under his care. Souleymane has been farming and raising livestock for over 25 years. He gets his supplies from the local villages. With the requested loan, he wants to purchase 10 sacks of fertiliser, five 20-litre containers of petrol and seven crates of insecticides. He wants to use the profits to strengthen his business, pay for his children's school fees and start some savings. His goal is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertiliser, five 20-litre containers of petrol and seven crates of insecticides

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La   Sra. Lorenza tiene 56 años, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos todos mayores de edad que trabajan independiente, ella tiene una despensa en su casa, y comenta que tiene muchos clientes, ya que la mayoría son de su barrio.
Ella se fue abriendo camino con mucho esfuerzo y lucha, y está poniendo cada día un mayor sacrificio para poder mejorar. Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como verduras, frutas, lácteos, panificados y otros, y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Lorenza is 56 years old, single and has two adult children who work independently.  She has a store in her house and comments that she has many clients, and the majority are from her neighborhood.  

She paved the way with great effort and struggle, and every day makes sacrifices to improve.  She is asking for this loan to buy the stock for her store, including vegetables, fruits, dairy products, baked goods, and others and to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, dairy products, baked goods, and others.

loans.name: Nila Ana

texts.es:
Nila tiene 57 años de edad, casada, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la peluquería. 
Ella es emprendedora, decidida, constante, amable, comprometida, responsable y muy  trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ dónde hicieron su hogar los damnificados del desborde del río, situado a 12 kilómetros del centro de la ciudad. Los pobladores llegaron de las provincias y el resto del país y se asentaron en esta zona que hoy tiene más del 20% del total de la población, Es el distrito más pobre. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Nila es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como transportista. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la peluquería, ella realiza cortes de cabello, tinte, rayos, ondulaciones, peinados, y otros. Anteriormente tenía como principal actividad la tienda de barrio, y actualmente cuenta con 2 actividades, “debido a la demanda de peluquería, necesito comprar equipos para mejorar mi actividad…” comenta. la ventaja de sus actividades es que son diferentes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para equipar la actividad de peluquería. Su sueño es abrir una estética, ella desea realizar la compra de una lava cabeza para mejorar el servicio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Nila solicita un préstamo para la compra de una lava cabeza para mejorar el servicio de su negocio de peluquería.
texts.en:
Nila is 57 years old, married with independent children and her business is hair styling. She is enterprising, determined, dependable, likeable, dedicated, responsible and very hardworking. She has her business in the “Plan 3000” zone where those who were ruined by the flooding river made their home, about 12 kilometers from downtown. The residents came in from rural areas and other parts of the country and settled in this zone, which today has more than 20% of the city’s population. It is the poorest district, The climate is subtropical and hot, with a temperature that varies during the day from 21 to 35 degrees Centigrade.
Nila has a tan complexion, short brown hair, brown eyes, is short in stature and of robust build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which is the local language, and she speaks Spanish for general purposes and in the business that she does. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a driver. They live in a room of their own, constructed of brick and cement with a roof of corrugated metal and a tile floor and they have running water, electricity and sewer service. 
Her business is hair styling and she does haircuts, coloring, streaks, waves, hairdos and other things. At an earlier time her principal economic activity was her general store and at present, she works at both. "Due to the demand, I need to buy equipment  to improve my business," she says. The advantage of her businesses is that they are different; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase items to equip the beauty shop. Her dream is to open a full-service beauty shop and she wants to be able to buy a hair-washing sink to improve her service. This is the second sequence of loans with the same institution in the seven years that she has been developing both businesses, For these reasons, Nila is requesting a loan for the purchase a hair-washing sink to improve the service in her beauty shop business.

loans.use: to buy a hair-washing sink to improve the service in her beauty shop business.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Afiwa est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Afiwa habite à Tokoin et vend des produits alimentaires et des céréales dans une boutique. Pour disposer du stock en permanence, Afiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Afiwa souhaite répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients qui désirent ses produits. Afiwa demande ce crédit pour acheter des bidons d’huile, des sacs de sucre et des sacs de farine afin de disposer d’une rentabilité pour couvrir ses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Afiwa, age 35, is a married mother to four children who lives in the district of Tokoin. She sells grocery items and cereals out of a stall. 

Afiwa stocks up twice a month to avoid running out of merchandise, as she is eager to fully meet customer demand. She is seeking this loan to buy jugs of oil, bags of sugar and sacks of flour. The profits earned will help her to cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 cans of oil, 2 bags of sugar and 4 sacks of flour.

loans.name: Julienne
