Isabel se dedica a la venta de ropa para todo tipo de personas y posee  mucha experiencia en este negocio, comenzó su venta con poco dinero y fue reinvirtiendo sus ganancias conforme fue vendiendo los productos, sus clientes son sus vecinos y demás personas que habitan en los alrededores a  su comunidad con cuales se ha dado a conocer debido a su amabilidad y carisma, es de esta forma como Isabel se gana la vida y lo que la impulsa a seguir día a día en el negocio. Isabel hace un tiempo comenzó la construcción de una habitación  pero debido a la situación económica no pudo comprar todos los materiales y no logro completar la obra, es por ello que ha tomado la iniciativa de adquirir un crédito en FUSAI para comprar: hierro, cemento, arena y lámina para poder terminar la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio que le brinde una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is 65 years old and lives with her five children, all of whom are now adults and lead independent lives. Isabel sells clothing for all types of people and she possesses lots of experience in this business. She began selling with very little money and reinvested her earnings as she sold her products. Her customers are her neighbors and other people who live in and around her community. They have gotten to know her due to her amiability and charisma. In this manner, Isabel earns her living and it spurs her to continue in the business day to day.

Some time ago, Isabel began the construction of a home. But owing to her economic situation, she could not purchase all the necessary materials and the job was not completed. That is why she is now taking the initiative of acquiring a loan through FUSAI to buy iron bars, cement, sand and laminated sheet metal in order to terminate the construction of a bedroom which will offer a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase iron rods, cement, sand and laminated sheet metal to finish construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
Don José, es un hombre de cincuenta y seis años de edad, muy enfocado en su negocio, quiere ser exitoso y sabe que la única forma para llegar hacerlo es trabajando duro. El posee una pulpería, la idea de abrirla, surgió porque él se dedicaba a trabajar de forma independiente, como albañil, pero con el paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que este trabajo se volvió muy pesado y tuvo que buscar otra forma de sustentar su hogar y asegurar su retiro. 
Él ya había sido beneficiado con un préstamo de kiva y MiCrédito, con este pudo invertir en una variedad de productos que hicieron crecer su pulpería. José, está muy agradecido y ha vuelto aplicar a un financiamiento para invertir en productos y comprar granos básicos, shampoos, detergentes, jabones, frituras, golosinas, entre otras cosas. En un futuro desea mejorar la infraestructura de su local, para convertir su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Don José is a man of 56 years of age. He is very focused on his business. He wants to be successful and he knows that the only way to be so is by working hard. He owns a small grocery store. The idea to open it came from his days working independently as a construction worker, with the passage of time he realized that this line of work became very difficult for him, and he had to search for another way to support his household and ensure his retirement.

He had already previously been a recipient of a Kiva and MiCrédito loan. With it, he was able to invest in a variety of products that made his store grow. José is very grateful for this and has reapplied for a loan to invest in products; to buy basic grains, shampoos, detergents, soaps, fried snacks, and candy, among other things. In the future he wishes to improve the infrastructure of his venue, so he can turn his business into a distributor.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, shampoos, detergents, soaps, fried snacks, and candy, among other things.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a hardworking woman. Harriet is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her mobile money business, which deals in mobile money lending. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add capital to the business, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and expand business. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: add capital to her mobile money business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking woman. Agnes is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 6 month, Agnes has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which deals in charcoal sale. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bags of charcoal, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and improve business. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger business. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a hardworking woman. Juliet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 9 month, Juliet has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food items, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and expand business. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to become a great entrepreneur. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy food items

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hard-working woman. She is 23 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her salon, which deals in hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase items for the salon, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to move into wholesale. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase items for the saloon

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah is a hardworking woman. Penninah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Penninah has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which deals in charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Penninah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bags of charcoal, and will help Penninah to generate greater profits and expand business. Penninah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a personal house. 

Penninah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Hasifah

texts.en:
Hasifah is a hardworking woman. Hasifah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Hasifah has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which deals in selling second-hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Hasifah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell, and will help Hasifah to generate greater profits and improve business. Hasifah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Hasifah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and metal fasteners to replace parts of the roof of her home; previously Silvia managed to make improvements to the beams.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Mahbuba is a challenged woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1984. She is living far from city with her children. She is divorced. She has many years of experience serving Tajik women with traditional dresses. It is hard for her to feed and ensure her children alone and she is responsible to work hard and earn money. She also sews traditional embroidering to textile. In order to have effiecient and effective business she wants to buy a computer sewing machine. She appealed to IMON asking a loan to buy computer sewing machine. She hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders and awaits your compassion.
texts.en: Mahbuba is a challenged woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1984. She lives far from city with her children. She is divorced. She has many years of experience serving Tajik women by making traditional dresses. It is hard for her to feed and provide for her children alone, and she is a responsible woman who works hard to earn money. She also sews traditional embroidery on textiles. In order to have an efficient and effective business she wants to buy a computerised sewing machine. She has applied to IMON for a loan buy a computerised sewing machine. She hopes that she will be supported by Kiva lenders and looks forward to your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a computerised sewing machine.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel, es una persona soltera, vive con su familia, tiene como actividad económica una pequeña tienda, en la que ofrece productos de la canasta básica y la tiene desde hace cinco años sin un horario establecido, de esta manera genera ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales y para apoyar con los gastos familiares.
El capital que ha solicitado le servirá para comprar frijoles, arroz, maíz huevos, bebidas y otro productos de uso domésticos para tener mayor capacidad de venta, espera que sus clientes continúen visitando su negocio y que los ingresos sean más estables.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar su negocio y seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Anabel is a single woman, lives with her family, and owns a small grocery store. In it, she offer staple goods and has had it for five years, operating without established working hours. By doing this she has generated enough income to cover her personal expenses and help with the household expenses.

The capital she requests will help her buy beans, rice, corn, eggs, beverages, and other household products so as to have a greater selling capacity. She expects her customers to continue to frequent her business, and for her income to be more stable.

Her aspirations are to grow her business and to continue helping her family economically.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, corn, eggs, beverages, and other household products so as to have a greater selling capacity.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a farmer and salesperson who is connected to many actors in the agricultural food chain. She makes income from mixed-farming and through engaging in the cereal trade as a broker. She owns a 1.75 acre farm which she has made good use of by keeping dairy animals and poultry, and growing bananas. To make extra income, she helps to arrange the logistics of getting cereal produce from local farmers to their buyers in urban markets.
 
Given that Doris is well-connected and can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Her role helps local farmers to focus on production, rather than sales.

Your loan will help Doris to make bigger returns from her business and take better care of her family's basic needs and wants.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily  is a farmer and salesperson who is connected to many actors in the agricultural food chain. She makes income from mixed-farming and through engaging in cereal trade as a broker. She owns a 2-acre farm which she has made good use of by keeping a dairy cow, 10 heads of poultry and grown 50 trees. To generate extra income, she helps to arrange logistics of getting cereal produce from local farmers to their buyers in urban markets. 

Given that Emily is well-connected and can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Her role helps local farmers to focus on production, rather than sales.

Your loan will help Emily to make bigger returns from her business and take better care of her family's basic needs and wants.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive con su familia, tiene una hija de 30 años quien ya es independiente, pero en ocasiones les ayuda económicamente, su negocio es cultivar granos básicos (maíz, frijol y maicillo), con las cosechas alimenta a su familia y puede vender a sus vecinos para ir teniendo ingresos con los que cubre otros gastos, además práctica la crianza de ganado. 
Necesita un crédito para comprar sácate y concentrado para alimentar el ganado, además adquirirá insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos en esta nueva temporada, espera tener todo lo necesario para que su negocio continúe creciendo y de la misma manera tener mejores ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son cancelar su deuda y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his family. He has a 30-year-old daughter who is now independent but who helps her parents financially sometimes. 

José has a business growing basic grains (corn, beans and sorghum) and uses the harvests to feed his family and to sell to neighbours. This provides an income to cover costs. José also raises cattle.

José needs a loan in order to buy hay and feed for cattle; and to buy farming supplies to sow basic grains this season. José hopes to have everything he needs in order for his business to continue expanding and to earn a higher income.

José wants to pay off his debt and progress with his family.

loans.use: to buy hay and feed for cattle; and to buy farming supplies to sow basic grains this season.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un gran hombre de 47 años de edad, es muy trabajador, amable y generoso que para poder darle lo mejor a sus hijos trabaja para una institución que se dedica al beneficio de la producción de café él tiene ocho años de realizar esta labor, para Pedro el trabajar para el beneficio de su familia es una bendición, pero desde hace algún tiempo se ha puesto a ver las necesidades de su familia es por ello que ahora se ve a la necesidad de que en la cocina es muy importante  tener una estufa porque será más fácil preparar los alimentos de su familia aunque una de las dificultades que Pedro tiene es  no contar con el dinero suficiente para poder adquirir esta estufa por tal razón solicita un préstamo para cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Pedro es contar con un negocio propio para poder mejorar sus ingresos y las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 47 years old. He is very hard-working, friendly and generous. In order to provide the best possible life for his children, Pedro has been working for a coffee-producing organisation for eight years. For Pedro, this work, which helps his family, is a blessing but, for some time he has been considering the needs of his loved ones. He has come to realise that it is important is to have a stove in his home as this will make it easier to prepare meals for his family. Pedro, however, does not have enough money to buy a stove and so is applying for a loan in order to buy one.

Pedro's big dream is to have his own business in order to increase his income and improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a strong woman who has demonstrated extraordinary devotion to her family. Pamela’s mother unfortunately endured a very long battle with a terminal illness during which Pamela stuck by her side. Pamela helped support her mother financially and managed her mother’s care for 15 years when her health began to decline. 

During this time, Pamela struggled to maintain a job to support herself as well as her mother, and at times, she was forced to sacrifice needed hours in order to be available to care of her ailing mother. Sadly, Pamela’s mother lost her battle to her illness, and Pamela was left buried under a mountain of debt. 

Around the time of her mother’s death, she was one of several employees who were laid off due to budget cuts, and was left without a job for a period of time. She has since made great strides to catch herself up as well as maintain her home, but just as Pamela is getting back on her feet and ready to move forward, she is faced with yet another setback. The air conditioner on Pamela’s home has stopped working and is no longer repairable. 

Pamela does not have the necessary savings to finance this major repair for her home; however, the temperatures inside Pamela’s home are hotter than outdoor temperatures and the heat has begun to affect Pamela’s health and sleep. She is hoping that SELF and Kiva can help her finance a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve her quality of life and save her money on her monthly energy bills. Pamela will also be rebuilding her credit as she pays her loan back.

Pamela will use her Kiva loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve her quality of life as well as help her rebuild her credit.

loans.use: to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve her quality of life as well as help her rebuild her credit.

loans.name: Garcia

texts.en:
Garcia is a strong woman and proud mother of four children. She currently works long hours to support her children, and to maintain her family’s household. Garcia unfortunately suffered a health related setback that left her confined to a hospital bed for a period of months, and during this time she was unable to work. 

Due to her strong work ethic, she was able to return to her job; however, she fell behind on their bills and has experienced a long financial struggle. Garcia has worked very hard to catch up as well as pay for her medical bills. She is currently in a much better position to maintain her family’s expenses. 

Unfortunately, during her time of financial struggle, she was forced to set aside her plans to make necessary repairs to their home. Garcia desperately needs a new roof due to a very large leak that has developed and is currently pouring large amounts of water into the home with every passing storm. Garcia has noticed that the home is beginning to develop mold, and she absolutely does not want her children living in a home that could possibly make them ill. She is also worried that her roof is going to cave in on her and the children due to the rotting of wood that is meant to provide structural integrity to the family’s roof. 

Garcia realizes that SELF and Kiva is her last hope of obtaining a new roof for her home to provide a healthy and safe environment for her children. Not only will Garcia receive a new roof with her Kiva loan, but she will be repairing her credit as she repays her loan. 

Garcia will use her Kiva loan to pay for a new roof so that she and her family will be able to once again live in a safe and healthy home.

loans.use: to pay for a new roof so that she and her family will be able to once again live in a safe and healthy home.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Félix es un pequeño productor de café en una comunidad rural de Jinotega. Vive con su esposa en su finca de 14 mz de las cuales 6 son de café. En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 150 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación comercio justo.

Como parte de las mejoras que este productor viene implementando en su finca actualmente está solicitando un crédito para renovar 3 mz de café, lo cual le permitirá lograr mayores rendimientos productivos e ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de este productor, es contar con una finca modelo en rendimientos y calidad de café, para dar a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Felix is a small coffee producer in a rural community in Jinotega. He lives with his wife on his farm of 14 manzanas, 6 of which are devoted to coffee crops. In recent years, this farmer has produced a harvest of approximately 150 quintals of parchment coffee, which he produces according to the Fairtrade certification criteria.

As part of the improvements that this producer has been implementing on his farm, he is currently requesting a loan to renew 3 manzanas of coffee crops. This will allow him to achieve higher production yields and a better income for his family. This producer's dream is to have a farm that serves as a model of production and coffee quality so that he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the supplies he needs in order to renew 3 manzanas of coffee crops.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hardworking woman. Florence is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Florence has been working hard to manage her salon, which deals in hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase items for the salon, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and improve business. Florence hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase items for the salon

loans.name: Paula Del Carmen

texts.es: Paula de 51 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus hijos de los cuales los dos de 10 y 16 años son menores de edad y ella les apoya con sus estudios. Paula es una mujer trabajadora que siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su trabajo en el cual presta sus servicios domésticos desde 11 años, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con una fuente de ingresos tan sólido. Paula desea construir un cuarto en su propiedad y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir un cuarto de lámina en su propiedad y de esta manera ampliar su vivienda. Paula espera contar con este apoyo ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual invirtió en el piso de su vivienda por lo que se siente feliz y agradecida, y espera poder contar nuevamente con este apoyo.
texts.en:
Paula, 51 years old, is a working woman who lives in a home of her own with her children whom both, 10 and 16 years old, are minors and she supports them with their studies. Paula is a hard-working woman who always strives to get her family ahead by leaning on her work, in which she has been providing her domestic services for 11 years now and for what she feels happy to have a so solid source of income. 

Paula wishes to build a room in her property and for it, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheets, wood, nails, and wire to build a sheet room on her property and this way expand her home. Paula hopes to have this support since she previously requested a loan which she invested in the floor of her home, for which she feels happy and grateful, and hopes to be able to count on this support again.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, wood, nails, and wire to build a sheet room on her home.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a hardworking woman. Jesca is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past nine months, Jesca has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which deals in selling second-hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jesca has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Jesca to generate greater profits and expand her business. Jesca hopes that in the future, she will be able to return to school. 

Jesca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which deals in bunches of bananas. 

To help expand her business, Mourine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bunches of bananas, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Mourine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Abizerwa Cb Group

texts.en:
Albertine is a group leader who is aged 39 years. She is married with four children aged between 5 and 14 years. 

The group is called Abizerwa, which means “the trusted” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses for changing their futures for the better. 

Albertine has an arts business that has been running for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more crafts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more crafts for sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 43-year-old single mother of four children. Five years ago, she started farming to cover the increasing needs and expenses of her family. Currently, she practices dairy and poultry farming for subsistence. She is very humble, and Juhudi Kilimo believes that giving her a loan will enable her to commercialize her activities and increase her family's income.

Rebecca is requesting a KES 25,000 loan to buy over 40 head of poultry in order for her current poultry venture to make business sense. The income that she makes from selling poultry products on this scale should be sufficient to put her in a position to repay the loan and pay for other personal expenses.
  
Rebecca hopes that, with the loan, she will be able to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 27-year-old married mother of three children. Three years ago, she started farming to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Currently, she is practicing dairy and poultry farming. She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers.

As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.

Mary hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a progressive smallholder farmer based in the Kaisagat area of Kenya. She is a married mother of two children. Sixteen years ago, she started farming to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Currently, she is practicing cattle, poultry, sheep, horticulture and tree farming. She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers.

As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.

Sarah hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 55-year-old married mother of nine children. Eighteen years ago, she started farming to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Currently, she is practicing subsistence crop and poultry farming. 

As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to introduce more poultry into her farm. Through this loan, she will be able to buy about twenty chickens, which will produce enough products and by-products for sale to enable her to repay the loan. After the first loan, she will apply for a second loan to gradually increase the number of poultry and, consequently, the income she makes off selling their products. 
Hellen hopes to grow her farm business in this manner to the point that her family's living condition and livelihood are significantly improved.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, debido  a la situación económica no pudo seguir estudiando, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos pero todos tiene su propio hogar y nadie dependen de ella.

María, desde que tenía 12 años de edad se dedica al trabajo de campo, especialmente a la agricultura, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió con su papá; además se dedica desde hace 10 años al comercio, esto lo aprendió por la necesidad y el deseo de ayudar a su pareja para sacar adelante a su familia.- Ella junto a su pareja siembran maíz, pipían y plátano, sus cultivos los tienen a unos kilómetros de su casa y para llegar lo hacen a pie, comienza sus labores a las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 m.d. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar semilla, abono, pesticidas y para preparar la tierra para sembrar los granos básicos.

María, sueña con construir su casa de ladrillo, porque actualmente es de adobe y comprar un vehículo para transportar su producto.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and studied until reaching 4th grade but due to the economic situation could not continue studying.  She has a partner, who works in agriculture, and has 4 children who all have their own homes and no longer depend on her. 

Since Maria was 12 years old she has worked in the countryside, especially agriculture, and she learned everything she knows from her father. She has also worked in a shop for 10 years. She learned this through the necessity and desire to help her partner support their family. Together with her partner they plant corn, squash and bananas.  

Their crops are a few kilometres from their house and they have to travel there on foot, starting work at 6am until 12pm. 
 
She needs the loan in order to buy seed, manure, pesticides and to prepare the land for planting staple cereal crops.

Maria dreams of building her house out of brick, as it is currently made from adobe, and buying a vehicle in order to transport her produce.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, pesticides and to prepare the land for planting staple cereal crops.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Salvadora, vive actualmente con sus tres hijos, tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, la ubicación le favorece mucho para atender a sus clientes y  no tener muchas pérdidas de mercadería, debido a que son productos perecederos, sus hijos son un apoyo para realizar sus actividades.
Con la finalidad de tener un mejor inventario bien surtido ha decidido solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en zanahorias, repollos, remolachas, manzanas, papayas, etc., ofrecerá frutas y verduras frescas a sus clientes, además tendrá capital para abastecer su negocio cuando sea necesario, espera que sus ventas e ingresos sean mayores.
Su visión es mantenerse trabajando para tener un estilo de vida familiar más digno.
texts.en:
Salvadora currently lives with her three children and has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the city’s municipal market. The location is very favourable to her attending to her customers without much product loss, given that her products are perishables. Her children support her in carrying out her business.

With the purpose of having a better inventory with a good selection, Salvadora has decided to request a loan to invest in carrots, cabbages, beets, apples, papayas, etc. to offer fresh fruits and vegetables to her customers. This way, she will also have the capital to stock her store as needed. She hopes that her sales and income will increase.

Salvadora’s vision is to keep working to have a more decent lifestyle with her family.

loans.use: invest in carrots, cabbages, beets, apples, papayas, etc. to offer fresh fruits and vegetables to her customers.

loans.name: Alkasim

texts.en:
Alkasim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village. Alkasim joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. 

Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alkasim will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

With increased yields and incomes, Alkasim has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tajiri village. Sule joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Sule suffered from poor yields that inhibited his ability to improve his farming skills. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Sule has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. 

With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Sule can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village.  Aminu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Aminu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Aminu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village. Yau joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yau will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yau now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.en:
Blanca Estela is married and has two sons aged nine and fourteen who go to a public school. Her husband works in a food processing plant. They own a house where she sells shoes to earn an income and also works as a tailor who repairs clothes.

Blanca Estela is applying for a 6,000 MXN loan through Kiva's field partner Kubo.financiero to buy more shoes to sell as well as materials for her sewing and tailoring business. She describes herself as both an entrepreneur and a fighter, as she is always looking for ways to earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her sewing and tailoring business as well as more shoes to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. 

Since joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim no longer has to worry about having adequate income to improve his farming skills. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Jibrin

texts.en:
Jibrin is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako Village. Jibrin joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Jibrin will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. 

This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Jibrin now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm’s yields

loans.name: Quang

texts.en:
Mr Quang is 44 years old and he is married.  He has had a service business laying bricks for 9 years.
Quang lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. He has no collateral cause can't get loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns his is not having a latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.
This is Quang first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Quang hopes for his business to do well, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thính

texts.en:
Mrs Thịnh is 43 years old and she is married.  She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.
Thịnh lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having latrine . She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build toilet.
This is Thịnh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thịnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Phương

texts.en:
Mrs Phương is 49 years old and she is married.  She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.
Phương lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase clean water filter machine .
This is Phương first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items for her salon.

loans.name: Medwin

texts.en:
Medwin has always had the enthusiasm for farming. He has cultivated his land in Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the land is ready for planting. Medwin knows that he has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Medwin hopes to till additional land area for more produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Nalam

texts.en:
Nalam has switched from selling snacks to "balut" (developing duck embryo that is boiled and eaten in the shell) making and selling. His business is doing well when he doubles his time in making and selling balut at Larena, Siquijor. 

With his wife's help, he has maximized his profits and keeps pursuing his goals for the good of his family. 

The reason why he took another loan of PHP 14,900  from PMPC is to buy more eggs for his balut making and selling business. Today, Nalam is able to help others from his balut selling business and earn for his own family.

loans.use: to purchase eggs for balut making and selling

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 43 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Iris wishes to become the supplier of backyard grown vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is managing her food-processing business in Larena, Siquijor. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well and supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts bulk orders for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more head of pigs to raise for her meat-processing business. She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to open a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to raise for her meat processing business

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en: Prescila is a businesswoman from Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 65 years old, married and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Prescila is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Prescila continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet describes herself as a happy and hardworking person. She opened a stationery store a year ago and then began to sell some groceries as well. She feels proud of earning a technological degree and then building her own business.

Jannet is asking for a 12,000 MXN loan through Kiva's field partner Kubo.financiero to buy more inventory for her store. Her goal is to send her daughters to college and help them succeed.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her stationery and grocery store

loans.name: Raul

texts.en: Raul is 61 years old. He is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. Raul is thankful to the Cooperative as his constant financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: San José Group

texts.en:
The seven members of the group San Jose live in the small village of Joya Grande, a few kilometers from the town of Zaragoza, Chimaltenango, Guatemala. They range in age from 21 to 50 and their business include the buying and selling of corn, small stores, sales of vegetables and sales of traditional clothing both new and used.  One of the women is illiterate and the highest level of education in the group is the completion of primary school. The women heard about Namaste through fliers the foundation had placed in the municipal market. When they attended an informational meeting they realized that this was a unique opportunity to learn about running a business, to have classes in money and business management and to have a personal Business Advisor to give them advice on how to invest their loan and how to grow their businesses.

Devora Floridalma is 22 years old, married with two young children. She was fortunate enough to finish primary school, something not common in her area.  Her husband, a local policeman, supports the family, but she wants to grow her businesses so she can provide more opportunities for her children.  She currently has two businesses, a very tiny store from which she sells a small number of food items and a small business selling used traditional clothing.  She is very hard working and with her loan she will buy more stock for both her businesses. Her short-term goal is to increase her sales.  Her long-term goal is to have several stores in different villages around Zaragoza.

As she enters the Namaste program her monthly net income is 1,999 Guatemalan Quetzales.  Over the nine-month loan cycle she hopes to increase her sales by 33%.

loans.use: to buy more items for her store and invest in her traditional clothing business

loans.name: Doris Janeth

texts.es: Doris es una señorita alegre con la vida, ella tiene  24 años y se dedica a  trabajar de mesera en un restaurante y además se dedica a  la crianza de ganado, comenta Doris que su padre es quien le apoya con el cuidado de sus animales,  Doris solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de terneros que los cria para venderlos y obtener una ganancia, Doris vive con su padre y un tío y su aspiración es la de mejorar su negocio y prepararse para el futuro y asi seguir siendo una joven muy responsable.
texts.en: Doris is a woman, happy with her life. She is 24 years old and she works as a waitress in a restaurant and also works raising cattle. Doris commented that her father helps her to care for the animals. Doris is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of calves to raise and sell them for profit. Doris lives with her father and an uncle and she hopes to improve her business and study for the future and thus continue being a very responsible youth.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Lương

texts.en:
Mrs Lương is 29 years old and she is married.  She has worked in agriculture farming food for 5 years.
Lương lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase clean water filter machine .
This is Lương first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Lương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Mrs Liên is 46 years old and she is married.   She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.
Liên lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase clean water filter machine .

This is Liên first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 34 years old. She is known in Ozamiz City as corn grits producer. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase construction materials for her house renovation. In the future, Myrna wants to build a solar drying facility for her corn grits business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, plywood, nails for house renovation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, posho, rice, flour, and beans.

loans.name: Lulita

texts.en: Lulita lives in Larena, Siquijor and wants to build her house from the ground up. She has applied for a loan to buy building material and paints and to pay her workers. Lulita hopes to sustain her snack vending business to continuously pay her co-op obligations.

loans.use: to buy building material and paints and to pay her workers

loans.name: Noraimah

texts.en:
Noraimah is a Muslim businesswoman known in Ozamiz City public market. She has been in cd & dvd selling business for 8 years. Noraimah is married with 2 children. She is doing well in her business that she wants to expand and offer more musics, movies and other entertainment in cd & dvd format. 

She decided to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 for business expansion. She hopes that through her perseverance, her business will work so that she can maintain her membership in good standing without any records of default.

loans.use: to purchase CD & DVD's to sell in her electronics entertainment store

loans.name: Patrocenio

texts.en:
Patrocenio is a 35 years old, married and has two children to provide for. He wants to give his family a good life so he engaged in a transport business to earn for income. He drives his own motorcycle used for transport. He aims to increase his income because of increasing expenses of his family so he decided to take a loan to buy motor parts for motor maintenance to continue to cater passengers and generate more income.

Patrocenio plan for the future to save money to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for his motor maintenance business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 31 years old and lives in Aloran-Oroquieta City. She is a widow with one child. For the past three years she has owned and operated a business providing motorcycle transport to local community members.

Daisy is a member of Kiva's field partner PMPC. She has no record of defaults and has now requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy a secondhand motorcycle.

Daisy is putting aside money to guard against future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her community transport business

loans.name: Tuyên

texts.en:
Tuyên is 32 years old and married. For more than ten years she has worked in the marine aquaculture business.

Tuyên lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in her village, and on top of that this region often suffers natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

One of Tuyên's most critical difficulties is not having pure water to drink. She is requesting a 1,620,000 VND loan, her first, to buy a water filtration unit through Kiva's field partner Thanh Hoa.

With the money she earns Tuyên hopes to keep her family healthy and well provided for, to succeed in her business and buy land of her own.

loans.use: to buy a water filtration unit for her family

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 69 years old and lives in Oroquieta-Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with children who are all now adults.

Teresita manages a pottery and supplies different pots of varied designs to many places in Misamis Occidental. She earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to pay for labor in her pottery production business.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for a long time. In the future, she hopes to expand her pottery production business.

loans.use: to pay for labor in her pottery production business.

loans.name: Teodesia

texts.en:
Teodesia is a 60 years old, married and have two children. She wants to help her husband as a barangay councilor to earn for living that's why she engaged in a sari-sari store business for two years already. She aims to increase her income because of the increasing prices of commodities for the family. 

She borrowed a loan to buy more grocery items for sell and able to increase her store inventory that will generate income.

Teodesia plan for the future to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for sale in her shop

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy owns a pig business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors who have a meat shop in the public market. She earns a minimum of 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins. She dreams to expand her piggery and be able to provide for the family needs.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Phosard Group

texts.en:
Chuuangkham is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Chuuangkham and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

The water filter Chuuangkham and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Chuuangkham and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Chuuangkham and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Nameuang Group

texts.en:
Youb village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Youb and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  

Youb and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Youb family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Imelda Santos

texts.es: Imelda de 30 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a  su compañero de vida  e hijos de 14, 8, 6 y 3 años de edad. Imelda desde hace un par años montó una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación, en la cual se encarga de vender productos básicos de primera necesidad, tales como huevos, sopas, golosinas y otros productos. A pesar que sus ventas son muy buenas, Imelda necesita aumentar los productos de su tienda debido a la demanda de sus clientes por una mayor variedad de productos y a la vez poder percibir mejores ingresos económicos para suplir todas las necesidades de su hogar, debido a que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios, ella solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de: bebidas enlatadas, harinas, verduras, y productos de aseo personal para  poder cumplir su deseo de incrementar el inventario de su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Imelda, 30 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and children, who are 14, 8, 6, and 3 years old. A few years ago, Imelda opened a small store in her house, from which she sells basic goods, such as eggs, soup, snacks, and other products. 

Even though her sales are very good, Imelda needs to increase the amount of product in her store due to the demand from her customers for a wider variety of products. She also wants to be able to earn a higher income to cover household costs. 

Because she doesn't have the necessary resources, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy canned beverages, flour, vegetables, and toiletries so that she will be able to increase the inventory in her store, make higher profits, and keep her family moving forward.

loans.use: to buy canned beverages, flour, vegetables, and toiletries in order to increase the amount of product in her business

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita manages a snack business in Oroquieta City and supports her family. She has mastered the business when she and her husband were on the early years of their marriage. 

She has local customers and delivers snacks to school canteens for added income. She requests 10,000.00  PHP to buy bananas, flour, and sugar. She wants to expand her business and open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to buy bananas, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna makes good earning farming in Cantabon, Siquijor, supports her family, and sends her children to school. She wants to increase her yield  to meet the high cost of living when her children entered college. 

Edna requests 14,900.00 PHP from Paglaum MPC  to purchase fertilizer and a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this  season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and a knapsack sprayer.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 53-year-old married woman from Caticugan, Siquijor.  Lilia has owned and operated a farm for six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and  farm business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lilia requests a new loan of 2,000 PHP  to purchase additional farm inputs and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a strong-willed woman who stretches herself when it comes to her  business. She lives in Aloran-Oroquieta City and raises hogs. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never tires of supporting  her family. 

She requests a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins. She wants to construct concrete the pig pens and purchase additional pigs.  Someday she hopes to open a meat shop.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Naxay Group

texts.en:
Vanhthong lives in a village in Laos that derives much of its drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. This water is not safe to drink without being boiled. Vanhthong and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families’ budgets, as treating drinking water requires cash and time.

Vanhthong and her village members have now applied for a 15,000,000 LAK group loan to buy TerraClear water filter units. The filters are guaranteed for a minimum of two years. Her group is pleased that they are available on a payment plan that makes them much more affordable.

With the use of these filters Vanhthong’s family should see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. Significantly, she and others will be able to shift their time to other pursuits.

loans.use: to buy a TerraClear water filter that will give her family safe and pure water to drink.

loans.name: Hatkhai Group

texts.en:
Champee and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

They also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Champee and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. Champee is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

The water filter Champee and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 24 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.
Lan lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.


Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase clean water filter machine .


This is Lan first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Lan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 58-year-old widow with children who resides at Oroquieta City, Mis.Occ. 

She joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the coop. She requests 5,000.00 PHP for additional working capital to buy a variety of commodities to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of items.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy operates a motor transportation business for her neighbors and local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day. 

She needs 4,000.00 PHP to purchase spare parts to  repair her vehicle. She would like to  own additional motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and repair of her vehilcle.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is 63 years old. She is known in Dipolog City as vegetable vending in their public market. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to buy building material, paints & pay her workers.

loans.use: to buy building material, paints & pay her workers

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is responsible and dedicated farmer together with her children. Aside from her corn plantation, she also owns a vegetables stall in a public market that give her another source of income while waiting for harvest season of her corn farm. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. 

She applied for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 in order to purchase fertilizers and insecticides to increase production. This will allow her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for her corn plantation

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a farmer from Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She borrowed a loan to start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Josefina feels she owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to her business. 

Recently, he availed a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Josefina wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for her corn farm

loans.name: Josebel

texts.en:
Josebel is a 49-year-old married framer from Aloran-oroquieta City. 

She joined PMPC. Paglaum MPC to borrow money when she needed it the most. She requests a loan of 5,000.00 PHP for the up-coming season.  Josebel perseveres and plans to reach her goal which is to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer  and laborers.

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en: Marrieta lives in Aloran-Oroquieta City. She is a 50-year-old widow. Marrieta makes good living from her farming activities in Aloran, which is in Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially that given the high costs she expects when her children enter college. She approached Paglaum to lend her PHP 5,000, which will enable her to buy a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have a good crop this season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is very grateful for your generosity, lenders. Because you gave her your heartfelt help when you made an earlier loan to her, she found the hope to keep going. Today, she is involved in her small sari-sari store (general store) business. In this way, she continues to support her family. Aside from this, she also operates a direct-sales business. She also received an earlier loan improve her inventory. At times, her income may not be as much as expected, but the family remains firm in their belief that some day they will be able to achieve their dreams and realize their hope to succeed. To gain inspiration, Ursula faithfully attends a weekly fellowship* meeting where she studies the word of God, together with her colleagues. Now, Ursula needs your help again. She humbly asks for a PHP 40,000 loan, which she will use to stock her store with more grocery items to sell. She hopes that you will be able to support her again with this loan. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to supply her store with more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Phonenady Group

texts.en:
Vongvilay is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan. Vongvilay and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Vongvilay and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. 

 Vongvilay and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Matthew and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anjanith

texts.en:
Anjanith is 19 years old and single with one child. Anjanith works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, and personal care products.

Anjanith has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, and personal care products

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 63-year-old, married woman who lives in Aloran-Oroquieta City. She wants to prepare for the upcoming season and purchase fertilizer with a loan of 10,000 PHP. 

Eliza hopes to save enough money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is married to a man who has worked as  a driver  for nine years.They offer public transportation and is able to support her family and educate her children. She will use this loan to purchase a motorized unit to increase her income and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase another motorized unit.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is a 35-year-old widow. She owns and operates a sari-sari store (general store) in her neighborhood. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately PHP 9,000 a month. Emily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities, as she is the breadwinner since her husband’s death. She successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is applying for a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to buy additional inventory and used as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumables.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en: Ely learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Ely tried his luck on doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital despite that he is already 63 years old. Ely loaned another amount of PHP 20,000.00 to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help his farming income a big boost. Ely looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla sends her appreciation and thanks for her previous loan which helped her to buy additional products for her business. She successfully repaid  50,000 PHP which she  used to increase her inventory. 

She would like to improve her sales and requests 30,000 PHP to purchase more merchandise. 

She wants to grow her business and have a better lifestyle. She prays for good health and peace within their family. She meets  weekly with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell..

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, 25, is the mother of two children. She wants to earn a living to help her husband, a government employee, in providing for her children. So she engages in banana production. She also delivers bananas to the market. She aims for a better income. As a mother, she always wants to do what is best for her family, which is why she took out a loan to buy fertilizer for the banana farm.  In this way, she will be able to produce good quality bananas to deliver to her customers at the market, and thus generate more income. Arlene plans, in the future, to save money to sustain the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Retailing helps Lita provide for the family. She retails charcoal and brings in a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. 

She finds the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needs to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. 

Lita plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail. Lita smiles at the idea of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is very thankful to Kiva for granting her a loan of PhP 30,000, which she used to buy a side-car for her motorcycle to be used to provide transport services, and to make available more working capital for her business buying and selling scrap. Cynthia’s scrap business has improved, as she can now buy scrap in bulk, not just from her neighbors but also from other dealers. Her scrap stock fills their yard, since their tricycle cannot handle all the scrap she has  bought. Cynthia’s business is good, and she was able repay the loan on time and to provide for the schooling of her children. 

Cynthia is diligent and has positive saving habits.  She wants to buy a much larger vehicle to transport her scrap, and she plans to use the tricycle as a public transport vehicle to earn additional income. Cynthia is now applying for a loan of PhP 40,000. When added to her savings, this will permit her to buy a vehicle to transport her scrap in bulk to bigger shops and employ a helper to deliver her scrap. The loan will enable her to increase her income, as she will deliver her goods in much larger quantity, use less fuel, and use less of her time. Cynthia is looking forward to fulfilling her dream of seeing her children finish school, and she still hopes to secure a house of their own. Because Cynthia now delivers her scrap in much larger quantities, with the assistance of her helper, she is now on our small enterprise program, as she is providing employment to a neighbor.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to transport her scrap in bulk to bigger shops.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a married woman, 52 years old, with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Amelita has been in this business for one year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Oanh's Group

texts.en:
Oanh, born in 1965, is a Kinh ethnic woman, living with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Son La city in the Son La province. 

Her family’s main occupation is running a grocery store. Because there are so many competitive grocery stores around her family’s store, the income of her family is just enough to cover the living expense and save a small amount of money. 

She wants to raise chickens to sell to get more income for her family but the saved amount is not enough for her to do it. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan will help her family invest in the chicken raising model more effectively with high productivity, and next year this model will bring her family a considerable profit. For herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise chickens

loans.name: Los Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PROGRESISTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Giuliana Annabella ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa , la socia vende chompas,pantalones,polos y blusas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones o sus amigos,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, polos pantalones y blusas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de peluches, negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agencia de viajes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
