These members belong to the “LOS PROGRESISTAS" communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of the same name.

Giuliana Annabella is one member. She is 40 years old, single and has three children. She works in her business selling clothing. She sells sweaters, shirts, pants and blouses. She works from 8 am until 7pm taking them to different places like institutions or to her friends. Through this business she gets her family ahead. She has been in the business for five years and things are going well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her clothing. She is requesting this loan to buy sweaters, shirts, pants and blouses.

The other members work in businesses selling stuffed toys, the sales of candy, a grocery store and a travel agency. She thanks the people who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments within the established time.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, shirts, pants and blouses.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana is 70 years old and married, and lives in Aloran-Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns a rice field in which she personally manages, together with her husband. She learned about Paglaum MPC and the services they extend to small scale farmers like her. 

She is availing a loan of PHP 6,000 to pay labor costs for land preparation like plowing and leveling to start up this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for land preparation like plowing and leveling of land

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Mrs Trang is 21 years old and she is married.  She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.
Trang lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase clean water filter machine .

This is Trang first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Trang hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is managing her food stall business in Ozamiz City. She has mastered the business for 2 decades now. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, she was loaned an amount of 38,000.00 PHP to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her food stall business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her food stall business

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities aside from the fact that she earns, it has a therapeutic effect to her as well for her. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has seek financial help to purchase variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.In the future, Adela wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

loans.name: Yoyhai Group

texts.en:
Peng is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Peng and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

The water filter Peng and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Peng and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Peng and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Tuoi's Group

texts.en:
Tuoi, 38 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Son La city, in Son La province. 

Her family’s main source of income is her husband’s meager salary. Though they have a monthly stable income, it is just enough to cover the basic living expenses of the family. 

Her children are all at school age, so the expense is great while her husband's salary is not enough to pay for the children’s education fees. Therefore, she wants to take a loan to pay for their children’s education fees and may invest more if there is some money available.  

She expects much from that loan which will help her children have better conditions for learning, and then they will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay the children’s education fees

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a businesswoman from Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 47 years old, married and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Rosalina is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied a loan of PHP 11,000.00 to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Rosalina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 33 years old. He is married with six children. 

Stanley has had a motorcycle business for seven years. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle and hopes that this will help him to pay school fees. 

Stanley's hopes and dreams for the future are to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, debido a la pobreza no pudo seguir estudiando, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos están en la escuela.

María, desde que tiene 10 años de edad comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió con sus padres, luego a sus 17 años de edad se acompaño y a continuado trabajando en la agricultura con su pareja, ahora siembran maíz y pipían, sus cultivos están a 1 kilómetro y medio de su casa.- María, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para preparar el desayuno a sus hijos y luego llevar su hijo pequeño donde un familiar, para que lo cuide mientras lleva el desayuno a su esposo y le ayuda a trabajar hasta las 11:00 a.m. ya que tiene que regresar a atender a sus otros.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono y pesticidas para preparar la tierra y sembrar sus granos básicos.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos estudien y se preparen academicamente, además sueña con construir una casa de ladrillo, porque en la que actualmente vive es de adobe; tambien, quiere comprar una vaca para tener leche para sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 26 years old, studied through fifth grade, due to poverty she could not continue studying, she lives with someone, her partner works in farming, she has 3 children, two of them are in school. 

María, when she was 10 years old, started working in farming, she learned this trade with her parents, then at 17 years old she began living with someone and she has continued working in farming with her partner, now they plant corn and squash, their crops are 1 and a half kilometers from their house. María gets up at 4:30 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and then take her small son to a relative’s, for them to take care of him while she takes breakfast to her husband and helps him work until 11:00 a.m., since she has to return to tend to her other children. 

María needs the loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to prepare the land and plant her staple foods.

She dreams of her children studying and preparing themselves academically, in addition she dreams of building a brick house, because the one in which she currently lives is adobe; also, she wants to buy a cow to have milk for her children.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to prepare the land and plant her staple foods.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a married woman with two children who are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 37 years old.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

Arlyn has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Reynaldina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reynaldina, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera y tiene dos hijos, pero todos viven aparte en sus hogares.

Reynaldina, tiene un comedor y vende ropa desde hace 5 años, aprendió este trabajo cuando lo hacia para otras personas; luego decidió comenzar a vender ropa y también coloco el comedor.- Antes, ella trabajaba para otras personas, ahora su horario es desde las 5:00 a.m. hasta las 4:30 p.m.

Reynaldina, necesita el crédito para comprar maíz, frijoles, arroz y para comprar una caja de ropa para vender, el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su comedor y para brindar un mejor servicio.

Ella sueña con tener un comedor más grande y que sus hijos sigan su ejemplo y sean hombres y mujeres trabajadores.
texts.en:
Reynaldina is 52 years old. She went to school through the 9th grade. She is single and has two children, but they live separate from her in their homes. 

Reynaldina has run a small restaurant and sold clothes for the last 5 years. She learned this work when she did it for other people; later she decided to begin selling clothes and also to invest in the restaurant. Previously, she worked for other people, now her daily schedule is from 5:00 A.M. until 4:30 P.M. 

Reynaldina needs a loan to buy corn, beans, and rice, and to buy a box of clothing to sell. The loan will help her to improve her small restaurant and to provide a better service. She dreams of having a larger restaurant and that her children will follow her example and be hardworking men and women.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and rice, and to buy a box of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a farmer and salesperson who is connected to many actors in the agricultural food chain. She makes income from both dairy farming and through engaging in the cereal trade as a broker. She owns a three-acre farm, which she has made good use of by keeping dairy cows and poultry. To make extra income, she helps to arrange the logistics of getting cereal produce from local farmers to their buyers in urban markets. 

Given that Elizabeth is well connected and can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Her role helps local farmers to focus on production rather than sales.

Your loan will help Elizabeth to make bigger returns from her business and take better care of her family's basic needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 53 years old with 3 children all in school.

Her husband is a tricycle driver with a minimum income, barely supporting their needs, especially for the school expenses of her children.

To help her husband Norma used to sell rice cake in the street of the market in their community, when she save a little from her income she started selling clothes such as shorts and t-shirts which increases her income. But because her clothes are stalled without permit, most of the time she was forced to evict her place. Norma wanted to have her own legal stall to sell her clothes so she persevere and work hard.

Norma has been SEED partner for 3 years and through time and hard work Norma clothing business improves tremendously. She has now a rented stall in a market and regular customers ordering her clothes. She is also earning a net income of PhP 2,000-3,000 daily.

Norma biggest challenge now is supplying the demand of her customers as she wanted to expand and be a wholesaler someday.

Norma is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy 10 dozen shorts, 15 dozen shirts, 15 dozen blouses, skirts, undershirts, and trousers to sell to her customers.

Norma is confident that with the loan she will be able to expand her store and hopes to increase her income to help provide better future for her children.

loans.use: To buy 10 dozen shorts, 15 dozen shirts, 15 dozen blouses, skirts, undershirts and trousers to sell to her customers

loans.name: Xien's Group

texts.en:
Xien, born in 1967, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been joining in the program of M7-MFI since January 2011. She currently lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law, and a child of her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family lives mainly based on her meager salary, so the income is just to cover living expenses. She wants to buy a breeding pig and food for it but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in the breeding with high productivity, and in the next year, the pig herd will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig and food for it

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, 60 years old, lives in Tawi-Tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental with her husband. Her husband is a farmer. 

Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through an eatery and snack vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks for their neighbors. 

She became a Member in Good Standing, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 8,000 PHP to buy merchandise inventories for her eatery and snack vending business. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy merchandise inventories for her eatery and snack vending business

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa has been into this business (operating jeepneys) for a very long time, almost ten years to count. In that long time, she has experienced a lot of ups and downs that made her strong enough in facing life’s trials. She thanks God that Kiva and CCT have been parts of this years-long journey.

Recently, she was given a chance to have a loan of PHP 30,000 that she used for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Today, she comes to you again for the same reason. This time, she asks for PHP 40,000 to pay for accessories, spare parts, and maintenance for her jeepney. She hopes that you'll help her again with her request.

Jesusa hopes to have a successful future far beyond their life today. She prays for higher profit from her business, and she is truly aspiring for a harmonious kind of living for her family, while simultaneously serving the Lord together through church ministries.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for accessories, spare parts, and maintenance for her jeepney.

loans.name: Dinh's Group

texts.en:
Dinh is a Thai ethnic man. His family consists of three members, including his wife and his daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

His family’s main income is from his meager salary so it is just enough to cover living expenses and save a small amount of money. He wants to buy fertilizer for the coming corn crop but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, he wants to take a loan for this purpose.

He will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time, and he hopes that the loan will help his family invest in the corn effectively, and then the yield of corn in the next year will be twice as much as in the previous year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Zia

texts.en:
Zia is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and four children. 

Zia is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a plot of agricultural land where he grows potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers. Zia is very hardworking man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. 

Zia owns a flat, but it needs renovation. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan and renovate his flat. When the flat is renovated, Zia will rent it out to earn additional income which will be used for his family's welfare.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Son, a Thai ethnic woman, has been a member of the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 1995. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the food for the whole family and save a very small amount of money. Her son is studying at a university, but the education cost for her son is what she is very concerned about now. She wants to borrow a loan to pay for her son’s education fees.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her son have better conditions for studying, and then he will have a good job with a stable income after graduation from university.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education fees.

loans.name: Sharen

texts.en:
Sharen has mastered her farming business in Dipolog. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family.  When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail of credit to fully support her business. 

Just as how she takes care her farming business and so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of Php 10,000 will help her purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Tình

texts.en:
Mrs Tình is 65 years old and she is married.  She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.
Tình lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase clean water filter machine .

This is Tình first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Tình hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 48 years old, married, and has a vegetables vending business in Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. 

Recently, Luzminda availed a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house repair. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Nongfue Group

texts.en:
May’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Mayand her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits. 

May and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like May’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Cristle Joy

texts.en:
Cristle Joy is a married woman, 18 years old, with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cristle Joy has a sound system rental business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts, wires, and other material for her business.

Cristle Joy has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, wires, and other material for her business.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga, born in 1986, is an ethnic Thai woman. Her family has three members, including her husband, her daughter and herself. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.


Her family’s main income is mostly from her civil servant salary, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and a small amount for savings. She wants to buy breeding pigs and food for them, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants a loan for this purpose.
	
She hopes that the loan will help her family invest effectively in the breeding, and that she will make a considerable profit when selling pigs next year.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Hi there lenders!  Angelina sends her utmost gratitude, as you provided her financial support that indeed helped her in her sari-sari store business! 

She still wants to continue her business operation. The problem is that she doesn't have enough capital to do so.  Therefore, she asks to borrow  PHP 20,000, which she would use to buy additional stocks of grocery items to sell. The main reason behind this expansion is that she wants to increase her profit to help her family to better support their daily expenses.  She really hopes for your helping hands. 

Angelina dreams of being successful in the years to come, including the dream of having her own house, lot and stall. At the same time, she dreams that her children will finish their studies as well. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Life may not be so easy as it seems, but when you have hope, nothing would be impossible. That's what Emily believes and she's thankful that you let her borrow an amount that helped her a lot in her food stall business and computer shop business recently. Because of that, she was able to increase her profit in such a way that she was able to supply her family with their basic needs at home.

She would like to access again another loan that she would use to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling for her food stall. A PHP 45,000 loan is enough to cater these. She really hopes that you'll entrust her again this time. You know that the main reason why she does persevere in her business is to provide and invest a better future for her family. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 62 years old, married with six children.

Lea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other groceries to sell.

Lea has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general Store for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and buy and sell dried fish.

Lea aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hien, 24 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children (one son and one daughter) in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main occupation is farming, so her income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and to pay for her children’s education fees. 

She wants to build a house with a clean sanitary work but she does not have enough money to do it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy materials for this purpose. She hopes the loan amount will help her family have a spacious house with a clean sanitary work so all members of the family have better and healthy living conditions.

loans.use: to build a house with new and clean sanitary work for the health of her family

loans.name: Estellieta

texts.en:
Estellieta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estellieta is 41 years old and has four children are presently in school.

Estellieta has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Estellieta requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Estellieta has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Dien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dien, is the Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and a child of her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses and save a small amount. She wants to expand the model of raising pigs to take meat for sales but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding at high quality and productivity. 

Next year when selling pigs, she can get a considerable profit.

loans.use: to expand her business of raising pigs

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 52 years old and has four children. Fely is single and has four children are currently in school.

Fely is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Fely requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fely has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farm

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 34 years old and has three children. Janeth is married and has three children are still in school.

Janeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Janeth has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Working hard for your loved ones- it's priceless. 

This is Luz, 58, from Las Piñas City, Philippines. She is currently taking over a school supplies business.  She is married to Samuel who works as an overseas Filipino worker. Summing up their income, they earn a living for their household. 

Luz dreams of having a better life for her kids. This kids the main reason why she wants to expand her inventory. Here, she really needs your help. She envisions a developed business but apparently, she's financially incapable. So, to make a remedy, she would like to ask a loan form you worth PHP 50,000. She would utilize this in purchasing more school supplies and other relative items to sell. 

She knows that you'll help her cross this. This is now your time to make an impact on a person's life. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing more school supplies and other relative items to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna owns and operates a food stall today. She has been successful in operating the businesses for many years, and she repaid her previous loan faithfully. From her business, she is able to cover her household's basic expenses. 

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings in larger quantities to be used for cooking her recipes. She is hopeful that you'll be able to help her with this. 

Edna hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future, and of being able to send her kids to college to finish their courses. She is also aspiring to have her own canteen business someday. 

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings in larger quantities to be used for cooking her recipes.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman, 45 years old with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lolita has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice and other materials to her business.

Lolita has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and other materials to her business

loans.name: Karla Marina

texts.es: Karla de 26 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su pequeña hija de 11 años de edad que es su mayor alegría, y le brinda su apoyo para que estudie. Karla se dedica prestar sus servicios en un hotel de playa lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hija y sostener la economía de su hogar. Karla desea continuar con las mejoras en su vivienda, ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual logro construir su vivienda de ladrillo, por lo que actualmente desea construir divisiones en la misma y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tabla roca, madera, tornillo, pasta, cañuela de aluminio, etc., para construir divisiones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Karla, age 26, is a single mother.  She lives in her own home along with her young daughter, age 11, who is her greatest happiness, and whom she supports so she can go to school.  Karla works in a beach hotel, which has allowed her to help her daughter succeed and to sustain her household finances.  

Karla wants to continue making improvements to her home.  Previously, she requested a loan, which allowed her to build her house from brick.  Now, she wants to build room divisions in it.  For that reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheetrock, wood, screws, plaster, aluminum weather stripping, etc., to build divisions in her house.

loans.use: to buy sheetrock, wood, screws, plaster, aluminum weather stripping, etc., to build room divisions in her house.

loans.name: Vicente Antonio

texts.es:
Vicente, ofrece el servicio de peluquería y barbaría, tiene su propio negocio desde hace 4 años, atiende en un horario de seis de la mañana a nueve y media de la noche, tiene mucha demanda de sus servicios, debido a que en la zona no existe tanta competencia, es un profesional en el ramo por lo que no representa dificultades para continuar trabajando. Tiene una familia integrada por su compañera de vida y dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad.
Está pidiendo prestado capital para comprar sillas para cortar pelo, un espejo, dos máquinas y sillas de espera, la finalidad es equipar su negocio para que sus clientes estén cómodos y él pueda realizar un buen trabajo. El riesgo es la delincuencia que existe en su comunidad.
Sus sueños son tener otro punto de atención, lograr estabilizarse económicamente y darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Vicente offers hair dressing and barber’s services.  He has had his own business for four years.  He works a schedule from 6:00 a.m. to 9:30 p.m.  He has a lot of demand for his services, due to the fact that in the zone there is no competition.  He is a professional in this line of work, meaning he has no trouble in continuing to work.  He has a family which consists of his life partner and two children, ages eight and two.

He is requesting a loan to buy chairs for cutting hair, a mirror, two electric trimmers, and waiting chairs.  The goal is to equip his business so that his customers are comfortable and so he can do a good job.  A risk he faces is the crime that exists in his community.

His dreams are to have another service station, to be able to economically stabilize himself, and give his children the chance to succeed academically.

loans.use: to buy chairs for cutting hair, a mirror, two electric trimmers, and waiting chairs, with the goal of equipping his business so his customers are comfortable.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a box of chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
This is Catherine. Every week, she joins a group of people that studies the word of God. Here, she is inspired and encouraged to go for living with hope and joy. Despite the fact that they're family is not as so fortunate like other families, with her husband Joel, who is working as a property custodian- they persevere and work hard for their two kids.  

As of today, she is operating a small variety store business. Through this small stand, they are able to suffice the family with the basic needs, hopefully (can't hide the fact that their income at times is still not enough). She wants to improve this so she could also develop her sales; and she asks help from you. 

She humbly wants to avail a financial support amounting to PHP 30,000 to be used in buying more groceries to sell. She's really hoping that you'll grant her this. 

This is now your chance to help in just a little way. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to be used in buying more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, no cuenta con el capital que necesita para mantener su negocio funcionando, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar una cocina industrial, carnes, verduras, bebidas, condimentos, etc., tendrá materia prima para preparar la comida y mejorar la productividad de su negocio, además tiene pensado utilizar el resto del crédito para remodelar el local del comedor y así tener una imagen más agradable para atraer nuevos clientes.
Al utilizar créditos como herramientas para fortalecer su negocio ha logrado tener mejor equipo de trabajo, clientes satisfechos y genera los ingresos de subsistencia familiar.
texts.en:
María does not have the capital she needs to keep her business running.  She is requesting a new loan to buy an industrial stove, meat, vegetables, drinks, condiments, etc.  She will then have raw material to prepare the food and improve her business’s production.  She also intends to use the rest of the loan to remodel her dining venue, and thereby have a better image to attract new customers.

By using loans as tools to strengthen her business, she has been able to have better work equipment and satisfied clients, and to generate income for her family’s subsistence.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove, meat, vegetables, drinks, condiments, etc., to have raw material to prepare the food and improve her business's production.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto es un señor que actualmente vive con su hijo de 17 años de edad, es la única persona que depende de él, se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y café, además tiene una granja de pollos de engorde, su negocio lo tiene desde hace 20 años y lo desarrolla a tiempo completo.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar abono e insecticidas para que su cultivo de café tenga un buen desarrollo y así tener una cosecha más abundante para lograr atender los pedidos actuales de sus clientes y buscar otros nuevos, espera que su negocio continúe con vida y así tener un estilo de vida más digno.
Humberto tiene como propósito administrar lo mejor posible el crédito y resarcirlo lo más pronto posible.
texts.en: Humberto is a man who currently lives with his 17 year old son. He is the only dependent he has.  He works growing corn, beans, and coffee besides having a poultry farm. He has had this business for 20 years and he works full time. He will use the loan to buy manure and insecticides to help his coffee crops develop well and thus, have a more abundant harvest to fill all his current client orders and to look for new clients. He hopes that his business will continue to grow, to allow him  to have a more dignified lifestyle. Humberto wants to administer the loan the best he can, and be able to repay it as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides to help his coffee  crops develop well.

loans.name: Marling Josefa

texts.es:
Marling es una mujer esforzada, que se levanta temprano cada día, para trabajar duro en su pulpería, junto con su familia ha logrado hacer prosperar su negocio. Esta mujer emprendedora ha logrado incrementar su inventario con muchos productos que no ofertaba antes, como por ejemplo, detergente, jabones, shampoo, entre otros. 
Para ella las oportunidades de crédito son muy importantes, porque le permiten fortalecerse como comerciante. En estos momentos ella solicita un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, para poder comprar granos básicos por mayor y así comenzar a ofertarlos a su clientela. En un futuro desea mejorar la infraestructura de su local, además de poder invertir en otros negocios.
texts.en: Marling is a committed woman. She wakes up early every day to work hard in her grocery store. Along with her family, she has been able to make her business grow.  This entrepreneurial woman has increased her inventory with many products she didn't offer before, such as detergent, soaps, shampoo, among others. For her, the credit opportunities are very important because they allow her to strengthen her as a business person. She is currently asking for a loan from Kiva and MiCredito to buy basic grains wholesale, and thus begin to offer them to her client base. In the future, she wants to improve the infrastructure of her shop, as well as invest in other businesses.

loans.use: To buy basic grains wholesale.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is a father of two children. He engaged in a construction supply store business to earn for living with the help of his wife in managing their business. He and his wife wants to increase their family income because of the increasing prices of commodities for family needs. 

So he decided to borrowed a loan to buy mote construction supplies for sell and increase his store inventory that will generate great income.

Rolly plan for the future to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies for selling

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a term used for variety) store sells different kinds of products from biscuits, candies, can goods, noodles, products used for personal hygiene and the like which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is considered as one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since it provides commodity for people. 

With this fact, Benita was enticed to get in touch with this kind of craft. She is 57 years old and a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. By now, she is working with determination to pursue the needs of their family. The income she gets from the store helps them for their daily expenditures. 

However, what profits she gets from the business is sometimes insufficient. It is because at times, she finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products due to financial incapability. This is why, she is requesting PHP 10 000 loan that she will utilize to buy additional products for her inventory. With more products displayed in her store, she can ably have greater increase in her income. 

In due time, she hopes that she grow in progress and that her business will boost in sales. Through this, she can earn and save money for her dream to have her own grocery store if God will allow someday. There is nothing more that she wishes but to yield her family into a better life near with God.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her inventory

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melody is 35 years old and has two children are still in school.

Melody has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Melody requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Melody has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials to her business

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 24 years old single and has two children.

Michelle is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Michelle has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable production business

loans.name: Victoria Liseth

texts.es:
Victoria está teniendo resultados positivos al haber invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio, ha mejorado la calidad del pan artesanal y tiene nueva mercadería en su tienda, junto a su esposo comparten un estilo de vida más digno, son una familia emprendedora que lucha cada día por salir adelante.
Considerando que las demandas son mayores ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar pan, huevos, bebidas, papel higiénico, boquitas y otros productos al mayoreo para disminuir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: Victoria is having positive results by having invested her last loan in her business. She improved the quality of her artisan bread and has new merchandise in her store. Along with her husband, they share a more dignified quality of life, they are an enterprising family who struggles every day to get ahead. Taking into consideration the greater demand in her business, she decided to ask for a new loan to buy bread, eggs, beverages, toilette paper, snacks and other wholesale products to reduce her clients needs.

loans.use: To purchase bread, eggs, beverages, toilette paper, snaks and other wholesale products to reduce his clients needs

loans.name: Jeremías

texts.es:
Jeremías es un gran hombre trabajador  que gracias al entusiasmo que le dedica a su negocio ha mejorado mucho, pues en estos días con el apoyo del crédito le fue mejor  pues gracias a este apoyo el logro comprar su mercadería para poder darle a los clientes un mejor servicio, él cuenta que ahora su clientela ha mejorado mucho y con ello sus ingresos, y con estos cambios el espera seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia es por ello que solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de cemento, cal arena, laminas y poder realizar la remodelación de su vivienda que tanta falta le hace a su hogar pues con el paso de los años se  ha ido deteriorando.
El gran sueño de Jeremías es poder contar con el préstamo para realizar la remodelación lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Jeremías is a great, hard-working man who, thanks to the enthusiam he gives to his business, has progressed a lot.  Recently, with the support of a loan, things have been better, because thanks to this support, he was able to buy merchandise to be able to give his customers better service.  He reports that now his clientele has improved a great deal, as has his income.  With these changes, he hopes to keep improving his family’s quality of life.

For this reason, he is requesting a new loan to buy cement, lime, sand, and metal sheeting, and be able to perform some remodeling on his house that it really needs, since with the passage of years it has been deteriorating.

Jeremías’s greatest dream is to be able to have the loan to perform the remodeling as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand, and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Phuoi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuoi is the Thai ethnic woman. Her family has five members, including her husband, her two daughters and her son. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. Her family has more than 9,000 square meters of cultivated land for planting coffee, and the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. 

She wants to raise breeding cow but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in raising breeding cow, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise a breeding cow, so as to provide an income for her family on the future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy better quality seeds, insecticide, compost, and pest control, in order to improve and increase the production of his crops.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old, married, and has two children to provide for. She works in banana production to earn a living and is able to help her husband as a farmer also.

She wants to increase her income so she borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm to produce a good quality of bananas and to be able to deliver plenty of bananas to the market to generate a better income.

Rosario's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Here is Analiza. Recently, she had a loan worth PHP 10,000 which she had used for her business within their vicinity. Actually, she sustains all her needs through selling clothes while ably helping her family at the same time. This is why, she would like to give her gratitude to those who lent her assistance previously. 

To improve sales, Analiza would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional clothes to sell and the same stuffs. With PHP 10,000, she can certainly make her livelihood improve and eventually grow with the grace of God. For now, it is her desire to have people like you who will assist her in her prospect. 

In the future, Analiza hopes to give her family a more favorable kind of living and simultaneously drive her inventory into progress. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional quality used clothes needed in her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Meet Evangeline. 

There is nothing she dreams of more than helping her family and giving them a more affordable kind of living. This is why she has worked so hard in her business to earn and save money. She is operating a sari-sari store, and recently she was granted a loan worth PHP 27,000 that she used to improve her enterprise.

To help her grow the business, she needs additional financial assistance. This time she would like to avail herself of a loan worth PHP 30,000 that she will utilize in buying more merchandise products to sell.

Thank you in advance for your generosity and heartfelt concern for people like her. 

In some time in the future, she wants to be able to go abroad and expand her business as well. 

She meets up with her fellowship group* every week to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that are each composed of 15 to 30 community partners and gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 60 years old and has four children. Myrna is married and has one child still in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Myrna has been in this business for 13 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her agriculture business

loans.name: Chuom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuom, born in 1970, is the Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is from planting coffee. She also raising chickens to get additional food for the whole family. Her family has one hectare of coffee, and each year after harvesting the coffee, the income is just enough to cover the living expense and saved a small amount. 

She wants to raise pigs for selling meat but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
She hopes much that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity, and then in the coming time she will sell a large amount of meat, bringing a considerable profit.

loans.use: to raise pigs as a new enterprise to add an income for her family's wellbeing

loans.name: Sumac Tica Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC TICA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hermila ella es casada y tiene 39 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Sumac Tica.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the SUMAC TICA Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which is part of Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  

This bank member is Hermila; she is married and 39 and she has 7 children.  She works at her grocery store and restaurant business; she sells necessity items, such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She wants to get ahead through this business; she is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  

The bank member whose face is covered by a circle no longer belongs to the Sumac Tica Communal Bank. 

The other bank members have an animal sales business, a maize liquor business, a grocery store business, and a prepared foods business. 

This bank member is thankful to those who are a part of this dream through this medium and she promises to make her payments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients for cakes, such as wheat flour, rice flour, butter, brown sugar, and milk, as well as some tools for shaping the cakes, etc.

loans.name: Mawoulawoè

texts.fr: Mariée, Mawoulawoè est âgée de 67 ans et vit avec ses trois enfants dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Mawoulawoè travaille parfaitement pour venir en aide aux différents besoins de sa famille. Mawoulawoè vend des fruits au marché pour trouver un revenu pouvant couvrir leurs charges quotidiennes. Mawoulawoè s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Pour avoir plus de revenu Mawoulawoè demande ce prêt pour acheter des paniers de pommes, des mangues et des oranges destinés à la vente et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mawoulawoè is 67 years old, married and lives with her three children in the Adidogomé neighborhood. She works very hard to help provide for household needs.  Mawoulawoè earns an income by selling fruits at the market, which allows her to cover everyday expenses. She stocks up twice a month. 

In order to increase her revenues and help ensure her children's education, she is requesting this loan to buy baskets of apples, mangoes and oranges for sale.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of apples, four bags of mangoes and four bags and oranges.

loans.name: Rodeth

texts.en:
Rodeth is 23 years old and Married with three children, two children still in school, Rodeth works very hard to provide for them.

Rodeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs and other personal care products.

Rodeth has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Agée des 34 ans, Amy est une femme mariée et vit à Avédji avec un enfant à sa charge. Amy entreprend une activité de vente des fruits dans son quartier et fait de bons profits grâce à son commerce. Amy s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Amy désire commander des paniers de bananes et sollicite ce prêt pour financer ses achats
texts.en: Amy is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Avédji with one child in her care. Amy is undertaking a business selling fruit in her neighborhood, and makes a good profit thanks to her business. She gets her supplies twice a month. Amy wants to order baskets of bananas and is seeking this loan to finance her purchases.

loans.use: To purchase four baskets of bananas.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans. Habitant à Totsi, Akoua  est une commerçante de  bijoux en parcourant tout le quartier en livrant  à ses clients. Son activité lui procure un résultat qu’elle ménage pour couvrir les charges de la famille. Akoua s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Akoua demande ce crédit pour lancer une nouvelle commande de chaines et de boucles d’oreille et faire encore plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Akoua is a 46-year-old married woman. She lives in Totsi and is a jewelry retailer throughout the neighborhood, where she makes deliveries to her clients. Her business turns a profit that she carefully manages to cover her family's expenses. Akoua gets her supplies at the market once a month. She is requesting this loan in order to start a new order of chains and earrings, and to make even more of a profit.

loans.use: To purchase seven dozen chains and 52 earrings.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 29 ans. Mariée, Ami est mère d’un  enfant et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser son éducation. Ami vend des fruits en se promenant dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Ami s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs d’orange et de bananes, Ami demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en: Ami lives in Adidogomé and is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of one child; she works hard to support her child's education. Ami sells fruit by walking through her neighborhood and the surrounding area for her livelihood. She gets her supplies at the market four times per month. Ami is requesting this loan to order sacks of oranges and bananas in order to make her purchase and make a necessary profit.

loans.use: To purchase seven baskets of oranges and five baskets of bananas.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga, who is a 38-year-old mother of two children, lives in the village of Gamarjveba. She works as a saleslady and gets approximately 400 GEL per month. Inga requires additional income to tackle the financial difficulties and make better living conditions for her children. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living, so she decided to start a trading business with the loan. With the loan of 2,000 GEL, she will purchase bed linens at wholesale prices and sell them in her community door-to-door. Inga will get the chance to make an additional source of income and increase her bit for the family's welfare.

She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her children have a good education for progressing in life. It is obvious that the job is hard for Inga, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually.

Inga is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: to trade in bed linens and make additional income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a coconut rasping machine

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es: Rosa de 36 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 17 años a la venta de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante recorriendo las principales calles de su municipio para ofrecer sus productos y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Rosa vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años junto a sus 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 10 años de edad y su esposo que son su mayor alegría. Rosa poco a poco ha logrado construir su vivienda, pero aún le falta instalar el techo para poder ver cumplido su sueño de contar con una vivienda digna, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, pines y alambre para instalar el techo de su vivienda para terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 36 years old, is a hard-working woman who has made a living for 17 years from selling fruit and vegetables on foot, traversing the main streets of her municipality to offer her products and so improve her income. Rosa has lived in a house on her property for many years with her 3 children, who are 19, 17, and 10 years of age, and her husband. They are her greatest joy. Little by little, Rosa has been able to construct her home, but she still has not installed the roof. 

In order to be able to see her dream of counting on a dignified home completed, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sheets of metal, beams, pins, and wire to install the roof of her home to finish constructing her home.

loans.use: to invest in: sheets of metal, beams, pins, and wire to install the roof of her home to finish constructing her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned drinks, flour and dairy products for her store as well as fertilizer for the crops that she grows together with her family.

loans.name: Efrain Galileo

texts.es:
Efraín requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar alambre, cajas de fusibles, aislantes, bombillos y otros materiales básicos para seguir brindando el servicio de electricista, el objetivo que tiene es satisfacer a sus clientes y mantener el apoyo para su familia.
El financiamiento anterior le dio la oportunidad de ser puntual con los contratos que tenía en puerta, sus ingresos han mejorado un poco y vive en un ambiente familiar más confortable.
texts.en:
Efraín needs another loan to buy wiring, fuse boxes, insulation, light bulbs, and other basic materials so he can keep offering his services as an electrician.  His goal is to satisfy his customers and keep supporting his family.

His previous loan gave him the opportunity to be punctual with the contracts he already had underway; his income has improved a little and he lives in a more comfortable family environment.

loans.use: to buy wiring, fuse boxes, insulation, light bulbs, and other basic materials so he can keep offering his services as an electrician

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Sewing fabrics is like shaping a person’s life. Before an end product comes, the fabric needs to undergo outlining or planning, cutting, and lots of piercing with the needle. The beautiful end products will be used as clothes, curtains, bed sheets, and many more. J

uliet is a tailor from Butuan City, the capital city of Agusan Del Norte in Mindanao. She is busy sewing clothes and school uniforms, especially this season because of the beginning of school. The demand for her products increases during this time. She seizes this opportunity to earn more and save some amount of money, because her husband’s income as a carpenter is very irregular. 

She has to buy more cloth, threads, buttons, and other accessories in order to produce more uniforms. Hence, she would like to get a loan worth PhP 8,000 to buy all these materials. This will be very beneficial in sustaining her household expenses and children’s educational needs. 

She looks forward to having more sewing machines and wants to put up a big tailoring shop someday. She is also working towards reaching her goal of owning a house and lot for her family. 


She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more cloth, threads ,buttons, and other accessories

loans.name: Bob Angel

texts.en:
Bob Angel is a 38 years old and single. He wants to help her parents for living. He engaged in a transport business and he also driving his own motorcycle. To increase his income as one of his goal, he borrowed a loan to buy motor parts for motor maintenance so that he can continue to cater more passengers that can generate greater income.

Bob Angel plan for the future to save money out from his business income.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans et mère de tris enfants. Adjo vit  à Adidogomé pour entreprendre son activité. Elle vend des bassines en plastiques et des assiettes en parcourant le quartier. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour acheter des bassines et des assiettes. Adjo désire réaliser assez de bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjo is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Adjo lives in Adidogomé to carry out her business. She sells plastic bowls and plates throughout the neighborhood. Adjo gets her supplies once a month and is requesting this loan in order to purchase bowls and plates. She wants to make enough of a profit to support her husband with the family's expenses and allow her children to get a good education.

loans.use: To purchase five dozen bowls and 120 plates.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 34 years old and married. To earn a living, she engages in banana production, and she also helps her husband as a farmer. She doesn't have any kids to provide for, but she and her husband are preparing for their coming babies. 

Thus, she wants to increase her income, which is why she decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm to produce a good quantity of bananas so she can deliver more bananas in the market that will generate greater income.

Michelle's future plans are to save money to renovate their house using her business income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more corn and fish and to provide for their children's schooling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more yarns, vegetables seed, fertilizer, green bean, milk, cormorant, a box of chicks, vitamins and  fodder

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old, married and has three children to provide for. She wants to help her husband, a carpenter to earn a living, that's why she has had a sari-sari store business for two years already and it really helps them for their daily needs. She borrowed a loan to buy more grocery items for selling and be able to increase her store inventory that will generate greater income.

Jocelyn plan for the future to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for selling.

loans.name: Martha Yaneth

texts.es: Martha es residente de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla en donde hace dos años funciona su almacén misceláneo, su negocio inicio gracias a su hermana que se dedica a la docencia y le sugirió que abriera este negocio puesto que le iba a dejar múltiples beneficios económicos y podría estar más cerca de su hija, ella no lo dudó ni un instante y tomo una de las mejores decisiones de su vida, ser una microempresaria.  Hoy en día cuenta con una clientela fidelizada que realizar sus compras de productos a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.  Ella maneja un amplio surtido de artículos para el cuidado facial, corporal, capilar, fragancias, papelería y detalles para toda ocasión.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para realizar unas compras de artículos de papelería, cosméticos, lociones y perfumes. Esta inversión generará un impacto positivo en la reactivación de las ventas y con ello un incremento en sus ingresos.  Su meta a futuro es lograr que su hija se gradué como profesional y en su negocio
texts.en:
Martha is a resident of a barrio located in the city of Barranquilla, where for two years her general store has been operating.  Her business got its start thanks to her sister, who works at teaching and who suggested to Martha that she open this business since it would provide Martha many financial advantages and she would be closer to her daughter.  Martha did not doubt this for even a minute and made one of the best decisions in her life, to become a microentrepreneur.  

Today she relies on faithful customers who make their purchases from 8AM until 6PM.   Martha manages a wide supply of articles for facial care,body care, capillaries, fragrances, stationery items and miscellaneous for all occasions.  At present she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan application she has made to the  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy some stationery items, cosmetics, lotions and perfumes.  This investment will engender a positive impact in the reactivation of her sales and with this an increment in her income.  Martha's future goal is to suceed in seeing her daughter graduate as a professional and for herself  to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy stationery items, cosmetics, lotions and perfumes

loans.name: Rose Fely

texts.en:
Rose Fely is 35 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Rose Fely is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rose Fely requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rose Fely has been farming vegetables for seven years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rose Fely would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricris is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maricris has a purified water retail business in the Philippines. Maricris requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of purified water to sell.

Maricris has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Maricris would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 50 years old, married with two children. One of whom is in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

Elma has been farming vegetables for 25 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, vive con un hijo de 30 años de edad, es soltera, como jefa de su hogar ha tenido que trabajar para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, ella elabora comida para vender, esté oficio lo aprendió de su familia, comenta que su negocio está en el mercado desde hace más de 15 años.
Pide apoyo a Padecoms y a los inversionistas Kiva con un préstamo para comprar verduras, aceite, condimentos, carnes, arroz, etc., al contar con los insumos necesarios no tendrá dificultades para preparar la comida que vende, espera aprovechar la oportunidad de trabajar con créditos para que su negocio crezca y su clientela sea mayor.
Sus sueños son tener mejor calidad de vida, cancelar su deuda y lograr estabilidad financiera.
texts.en:
María lives with her 30-year-old son; she is single, and as the head of her household she has had to work to cover the household necessities.  She makes prepared food to sell; she learned this profession from her family.  She tells us that her business has been in the market for over 15 years.  

She is asking Padecoms and Kiva's lenders for help with a loan to buy vegetables, oil, condiments, meats, rice, etc.  When she has the ingredients she needs she will not have any problems making the food she sells.  She hopes to take advantage of the opportunity to work with loans so her business can grow and she can have a bigger clientele.  

Her dreams are to have a better quality of life, repay her debt, and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, oil, condiments, meats, rice, etc. so that when she has the ingredients she needs she will have no problems making the prepared foods she sells.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, está teniendo buenos resultados al utilizar créditos para mejorar el inventario de la venta de ropa, se ha mantenido generando ingresos para subsistir con su familia y cancelar sus deudas.
Solicita nuevamente un crédito para comprar ropa interior, camisas, vestidos, pantalones, blusas, etc., renovara su mercadería con estilos de moda para que sus clientes sigan comprando.
texts.en: Ana has been getting good results uisng loans to improve her inventory for sale of clothing.  She has supported herself generating income to support her family and pay off her debts.   She is again asking for a loan to buy underwear, T-shirts, suits, pants, blouses, etc to update  her merchandise with fashionable clothing so her customers will continue to buy from her.

loans.use: to buy underwear, T-shirts, suits, pants, blouses, etc to renew her merchandise with stylish clothing so her customers will continue to buy

loans.name: Estela Abigail

texts.es:
Estela, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera, solo vive con su hijo y su madre.

Estela, tiene una pequeña panadería desde hace 6 años, aprendió a elaborarlo gracias a un programa de desarrollo comunal y fue así como decidió colocar la panadería en su domicilio y su madre le ayuda.

Estela, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos para la panadería.

Su sueño es tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Estela is 20 years old and she only studied until grade 9. She is a single mother, and lives with her son and her mother. 
Estela has had a small bakery for 6 years. She learned how to create the business thanks to a community development program. The program helped her decide to open a bakery in her home. Her mother helps her in the bakery. 
Estela needs the loan to buy supplies for the bakery. 
Her dream is to have a dignified home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the bakery.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 30,000 which she used to buy two fishing new nets and materials for building their fourth fishing boat.

To date, Julita's boat is already sailing and gaining an additional income. Julita was able to pay her loan on time and the revenue from her income helps with the schooling of her child in college and provide employment to her neighbors.

Julita saw another opportunity to gain more income as she and her husband found a market of low price fishing equipments in another town. At first with the use of her savings she bought the fishing equipment and sold it to her neighbors at lower prices than in their community market. In just a matter of months Julita's neighbors are asking for more equipment.

Julita is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 50,000 to buy fishing nets, floats, anchors, and coolers for her fishing business. Julita wanted to expand her fishing business by adding a fishing equipment store in her place to sell lower price fishing equipment to her neighbors than in their market, in this way she helps her community and gains an income.

Julita is now in our small enterprise group as she provide employments to her neighbors and helps her community to improve.
Julita's dream of seeing her child finish college is now within her reach, while helping others to reach their dreams for their families.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, floats, anchors, and coolers for her fishing business

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to him in the amount of PhP 27,000 which he used to buy a delivery van together with his savings. 

To date Angelo now has a delivery truck which he used to pick up and transport his scrap to a much larger junk shop which gain him more income and pay his loan on time. The revenue of his income helps provide for his family's needs.

Angelo today bought more bulk scrap materials and more valuable than before to increase his income more and with a new truck he can deliver his goods to other junk shops which pays higher than the other.

Angelo still biggest challenge is the lack of capital as he bought the good scraps to other scrap sellers. Angelo saw an opportunity when a scrap sellers wanted to sell a bulk of old tires and old roofs to him. 

Angelo is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy used tires, old roofs and other scrap to sell in a much larger junk shop.
