Angelo is confident that with the loan and with the vehicle for easy transport his income will increase to provide a much better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy used tires, old roofs and other scrap to sell in a much larger junk shop

loans.name: Lilian Rosaura

texts.es: Lilian de 29 años de edad es una mujer admirable que vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 15 años y un varón de 5 años de edad. Lilian se dedica desde hace 14 años a la venta de verduras en su casa de habitación actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Lilian desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Lilian is 29 years old.  She is an admirable woman who lives with her husband and their two children—a girl who is 15 years old and a boy who is 5 years old.  Lilian has worked for 14 years selling vegetables from her house, an occupation that has allowed her to move her family forward.

Lilian wishes to change the roof of her home since, as you can observe in the photograph, it has deteriorated.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, wood, nails and wire so she can change the roof of her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to change the roof of her home as soon as possible

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her daughter's registration fees before entering University

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old, married with four children. One of whom is in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food market business.

Marites dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable production

loans.name: Jossielyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jossielyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and buy and sell charcoal. Jossielyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Jossielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz aged 52 ,is a mother of two daughters and a son living in  Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and worked for some contractors in the past. He has 12 years experience in it.

Shehnaz husband was tired of serving contractors because they used to deduct from his salary for his minor errors and defects in the rickshaw, and because of this, he was being terrified by the threat of being fired almost daily. So Shehnaz, looking at his face and seeing the disappointment all the time, could not resist and applied for the loan, as she wants her husband to buy his very own rickshaw.  That way he could have the peace of mind which was missing while working for someone else.

Shehnaz really appreciates the efforts of Kiva and its partner BRAC, who are helping her in hard times. She hopes the sooner he gets his rickshaw, he will be able to pay back Kiva and its partner BRAC.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services

loans.name: Hatice

texts.en:
Hatice was in small retail business with her husband for long years. After retirement she opened her own store. Now she sells accessories for cellular phones. With the help of the loan she bought varieties of phone cases and accessories.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Hatice hanım eşiyle birlikte çok uzun yıllar esnaflık yapmış. Emekli olduktan sonra kendi işyerini açmış. Hatice hanımın cep telefonu aksesuarı satışını yaptığı bir dükkanı var. Mayadan aldığı kredi ile modaya uygun telefon kılıfları ve aksesuarları aldı.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea, opta por un crédito con el que básicamente comprara mesas y sillas para que sus clientes estén cómodos cuando visiten su establecimiento, así mismo invertirá en harina, quesillos, chicharrón, aceite y otros materiales para elaborar la venta de pupusas, mantendrá la continuidad de su buen desarrollo.
El crédito anterior le ha servido para contar con la materia prima necesaria que utiliza para que la venta de pupusas siga funcionado, su familia se mantiene y no presenta problemas de salud.
texts.en:
Andrea is requesting a loan which she will basically use to buy tables and chairs so her customers will be comfortable when they visit her business.  She will also invest in flour, cream cheese, pork rinds, oil, and other materials to make and sell pupusas.  She will keep her steady development going.  

Her previous loan helped her have the raw material she needed to keep her pupusa sales going; her family is taken care of and she does not have health problems.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs so her customers are comfortable, as well as to invest in flour, cream cheese, pork rinds, oil, and other materials to make and sell pupusas

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en:
Sadaf is 28-years old married woman, lives with her husband and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a metal shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing  different goods from people and selling it to the  factories. 

Nowadays due to household expenses, he does not have amount to buy iron goods and does not have any to sell for getting money. Therefore, Sadaf requested a loan for her husband, so that he could buy metal goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy iron's goods for her husband's recycling metal shop.

loans.name: Emie Angela Marie

texts.en:
Emie Angela Marie is 25 years old, married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell .

Emie Angela Marie has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Mary Jean dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edna is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Edna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Edna has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 40 years old, married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, egg, etc.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc

loans.name: Daviti

texts.en: Daviti is 59 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, son and his family. Daviti is unemployed. His wife and daughter-in-law trade in clothes and this is the only source of income for the family. Daviti has a space in his yard where he wants to open a bakery. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to open a bakery. He will renovate the space and will purchase all the equipment and materials needed to open a bakery. Daviti will bake Georgian bread to sell and will be able to have a stable income.

loans.use: to open a Georgian bread bakery

loans.name: Afsha

texts.en:
Afsha is the age of 31, living with her single child and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Afsha adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband provides canopies for the wedding ceremonies of people. Afsha is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. Her husband requires additional capital for the growth of his business. He would use the Kiva loan to purchase wooden planks and bamboo to offer more variety to his clients. 

Afsha hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks and bamboo for her husband's wedding canopy services.

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en: Goderdzi lives in Telavi with his wife and two daughters. Goderdzi has a vineyard and produces wine to sell. He wants to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for purchasing calves. He will raise calves and resell them at a good price. Goderdzi is experienced in this field and hopes that the business will be profitable. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves and raise and resell them at a higher price.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Cb Group

texts.en: Esperance is the group leader, aged 36 years. She is married with four children aged between 1 and 10 years. The group is called "Tuzamurane," which means “Support Each Other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to change to a better future. She sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, cassava and bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cassava and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nguvu Moja Group

texts.en:
Rahma is a divorced woman with three sons who are in school. She has managed a clothes business for a period of ten years now, working from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. She is in her mid thirties, working hard day and night to make sure her family does fine with what she gets from the business. Her family support depends on her business, which she wants to improve for more extra income.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her eleventh loan cycle, which she will use to buy new clothes for her shop. She used the previous loans, paid in full, to buy clothes of various types in new fashions. She is really doing great and is happy to see Kiva's support of her group. She managed to get a profit, which she used to cover school fees and house expenses for her family. In the coming years, Rahma would like to improve her business and family life.

The group members, six forming the Nguvu Moja group, will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  new clothes for her shop

loans.name: Sandra Maribel

texts.es:
Sandra, vive junto a su madre en casa propia, es solera y no tiene hijos, su negocio consiste en destazar cerdos y comercializar sus derivados, lo hace con la ayuda de su mamá, por el momento no representa dificultades en realizar sus actividades.
Invertirá en cerdos para el destazo, de esta manera la productividad del negocio aumentara y podrá atraer nuevos clientes, la esperanza de Sandra es tener ventas más altas y estables para mejorar sus ingresos y respaldar el pago de su deuda.
Los objetivos que ella tiene son ampliar su negocio y trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her mother in her own home.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  Her business consists of butchering pigs and marketing the products.  She does this with the help of her mother.  At the moment there are no difficulties in doing this work.

She will invest in pigs to butcher, and in this way the productivity of her business will increase and she will be able to attract new customers.  Sandra's hope is to have sales that are higher and more stable in order to improve her income and support the debt payments.  Her objectives are to expand her business and work with her own capital.

loans.use: to invest in pigs for butchering and in this way the productivity of the business will increase and she will be able to attract new customers.

loans.name: Jose Benedicto

texts.es:
José, agradece el apoyo recibido con el crédito anterior, ya que pudo tener los recursos necesarios para adquirir de manera rápida los insumos agrícolas que necesitaba en su momento para realizar sus cultivos, su familia continua con el mismo núcleo y los ingresos económicos son estables.
Tiene programado sus actividades para la próxima siembra, solicita un crédito nuevo para comprar abono, plaguicidas e insecticidas que utilizara para cuidar que el cultivo de granos básicos tenga un desarrollo favorable y puede tener una cosecha abundante.
texts.en:
José is grateful for the support he received with the previous loan as he had the needed resources to rapidly acquire the agricultural inputs he needed at the time to grow his crops. His family continues without change and his economic income is stable.

He has his activities planned for the next harvest, requesting a loan to buy manure, pesticide and insecticide that he will use to care for his basic grain crops to promote good development and an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticide and insecticide that he will use to care for his basic grain crops to promote good development and an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
Javier is a construction worker from the southern Mexican state of Tabasco. He lives in his mother's house with his wife and two kids.

As a construction worker, building things every day for someone else has made him realize how much he wants to build something for himself and his family. He and his wife have been making a big effort to save up as much as they can so they can start planning their own home as soon as possible. However, due to the informality of their jobs and their low income, accessing credit through other organizations is nearly impossible.

Javier needs a loan so he can get the materials he needs for his new home. He will be working on the construction of the house himself with the help of certified technicians to make sure the house is a safe environment for him and his family.

loans.use: to start building his house

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.en:
José Alfredo is known as a very reliable and responsible construction worker. He lives with his partner and they have three children, two girls and a boy, all attending their local primary school. José Alfredo is asking for a loan so he can build a proper home for his family. He wants his girls to have a separate room from their brother, and a place where they can escape the Tabasco summer heat, a house with proper ventilation and built with eco-friendly materials that can keep the house cool. Jose Alfredo sadly laughs at the idea of a construction worker with no home.

José Alfredo will be putting his own skills in the construction of his home, hand in hand with certified technicians to make sure they build a proper house that meets all the family requirements and safety standards. Jose Alfredo is excited to give his family this opportunity for a new life.

loans.use: to start building his home

loans.name: Juan Gerardo

texts.en: Juan Gerardo lives in the southern Mexican state of Tabasco. He takes care of his mother since his father passed away a couple of years ago. He is a hardworking responsible young man, who wishes for nothing more than for his mom to be comfortable in her own house. Her current house has deteriorated over the years, as it was built with perishable materials. That is why Juan Gerardo is asking for a loan as well as technical support so he can build a proper home where he and his mother can live, and where he can someday start a family of his own. The house will be built with the help of specialized technicians using eco-friendly materials.

loans.use: to start building his home

loans.name: Enedia

texts.en:
Enedia is 28 years old. She lives in the southern Mexican state of Tabasco with her husband and one child.

At the moment the three of them sleep in the same room. Enedia's mom offered them a little piece of her land so she can build her family a home of their own. Enedia works at a local retail store, and her husband works in construction, making around USD 900 a month between the both of them. They have been saving money for some time and they are close to having the necessary amount for a home of their own.

Edenia is asking for a loan to finish buying the materials needed to start building their home. Given that both she and her husband have no formal job and low income, it is almost impossible for them to access credit through other organizations or institutions. They will be working with certified technicians who will supervise the construction, making sure that it complies with safety and quality standards, and using eco-friendly materials.

loans.use: to start building her home

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs Dung is 28 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 5 years.
Dung lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase clean water filter machine .

This is Dung first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Dung hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine

loans.name: Judy Ann

texts.en:
Judy Ann is truly encouraged that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan that helped grow her coconut selling business. Her parents are so proud of her that, at her young age, she is able to help them in their financial needs. She continues to assist her parents meet the needs of their family.

She hopes that she will be granted a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase more sacks of coconut to sell. Coconut meat and juice is among the favorite fruit of Filipinos for its yummy and nutritious value. She already has regular buyers at their town market aside from the individuals who buy from her along the road. She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart. Her income from selling coconuts will surely help her finish college and help her aging parents support her siblings.

Judy Ann aims to buy a new delivery truck to easily transport coconut to the public market. She prays that God will continue to help her business prosper. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconut to sell.

loans.name: Jethro

texts.en:
Jethro is 26 years old and single. He wants to help his parents so he engaged in an optical shop to earn a living. He aims to increase his income so that he can provide what his parents need. He decided to borrow a loan to buy more eyeglasses to sell and be able to display more eyeglasses, which will result in a better income.

Jethro's plan for the future is to expand his business from his income.

loans.use: to buy more eyeglasses to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Leonora is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leonora has been farming vegetables for 30 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.es:
Marta, está solicitando más capital para comprar harina, manteca, cuajada y levadura para elaborar la venta de quesadillas que tanto demandan sus clientes, espera que las ventas se mantengan y que pueda seguir teniendo ingresos para subsistir con su familia.
Ha mejorado la calidad de su producto y cuenta con nuevos clientes, gracias al financiamiento anterior su negocio es más rentable y le da a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is asking for more capital to buy flour, butter, curd, and yeast in order to make quesadillas that her customers always demand. She hopes the sales support her and that she can continue to have income to survive with her family.

She has improved the quality of her product and has new clients. Thanks to her previous loan her business is more profitable giving her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, curd, and yeast in order to make and sell quesadillas that her customers demand

loans.name: Vilma De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Vilma, ha atenido una experiencia positiva al haber invertido el crédito anterior en su negocio de agricultura, la producción de maíz ha aumentado, sus condiciones económicas le permiten ir mejorando el estilo de vida familiar y cancelar con responsabilidad sus compromisos.
Ya ha iniciado la temporada de siembra y se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito, con el que rápidamente comprara abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, también podrá pagar mozos para que limpien el terreno para sembrar maíz, así estará manteniendo la continuidad de sus actividades y confía que el invierno sea bueno para que su cosecha sea abundante.
texts.en:
Vilma had a positive experience investing her last loan in her agriculture business. Her corn production increased, her economic situation allowed her to improve the family's lifestyle and she paid off her debts responsibly.

As the planting season has started she sees the need to request a new loan which she will use to quickly buy manure, insecticide and herbicide and pay for labor to clear the land to plant corn. Doing this she will maintain continuity in her business and she is confident that the winter will be good so that she has an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide and herbicide and pay to clear the land to plant corn.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, está progresando con la buena administración de los réditos que Padecomsm y Kiva le prestan, sus cosechas son  más abundantes y de esa manera tiene a sus clientes satisfechos y a su familia les puede dar una mejor alimentación, hasta la fecha no presenta ningún problema para trabajar.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito con el que básicamente comprara insumos agrícolas para ir preparando el terreno y sembrar granos básicos, para él los créditos tienen mucha importancia ya que con ellos puede tener todo listo para trabajar en el campo en menos tiempo.
texts.en:
Julio is making progress by managing the returns from his Padecomsm and Kiva loans well; his harvests are more abundant, which allows him to keep his customers satisfied and his family better fed.  He currently has no problems working.  

He needs a new loan that he will basically use to buy farming supplies so he can start preparing his land and plant staple grains; the loans have been very important to him as they allow him to have everything ready to work in the field in less time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to start preparing his land and plant staple grains

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is responsible mother and dedicated entrepreneur. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life that she is able to help her husband in their needs. Through the financial program of PMPC, she is allowed to be independent. There she has a retailing business of basic commodities. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. 

She applied for a loan amounting to in order to PHP 14,900.00 to restock her store with basic commodities and consumable items to increase her profit. She will buy additional canned goods, detergent bar, bath soap, soy sauce, vinegar and oil. This will allow her generate more income and be able to sustain the needs of her growing family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 31 years old and lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 4 children of whom all are school age. Rizalina is engaged in fish selling business with her husband as the driver of their motorcycle that transport their fish products to different places in Dipolog City. Through their fish selling business, they earns approximately PHP 1,500.00 per day doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to purchase second hand motorcycle unit for her fish selling business. Rizalina has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Rizalina hopes to expand their business and be able to deliver fish to neighboring towns of Dipolog City.

loans.use: to purchase second hand motorcycle unit for fish selling business

loans.name: Bắc

texts.en:
Mrs Bắc is 42 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising marine aquaculture for more than 10 years.
Bắc lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase clean water filter machine .

This is Bắc first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Bắc hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 55 years old, married, and has five children to provide for. She is engaged in a banana production business to earn a living and to be able to help her husband in providing for their children's needs. 

Nena wants to increase her income so she decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm. That way she can produce a good quality of banana and can deliver plenty of bananas to the market. Nena's plan for the future is to save money to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Fahoy Group

texts.en:
Bounkong  understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Bounkong  knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Bounkong  purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  

The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Bounkong  is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Ema

texts.fr: Ema est une femme mariée âgée de 42 ans. Mère de trois enfants, Ema vit à Agoè pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Ema vend des pagnes dans le quartier en se promenant afin d’avoir un revenu. Ema s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau stock, Ema sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des pièces de pagnes qu’elle pourra vendre et faire une bonne rentabilité afin de soutenir son mari à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Ema is a 42-year old married woman with three children. She lives and works in Agoè. in order to provide  for her family, Ema earns and income sells traditional colorful "pagnes" fabrics in her neighborhood as an itinerant vendor. She stocks up at the market twice a month. 

With the goal of replenishing her stock, Ema is seeking this loan to buy sets of  "pagnes"  for sale in order to earn a good profit margin and help her husband provide for the everyday needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy 11 sets of traditional fabric.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Daisy runs a business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. Daisy has been running the pig raising business for six years and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Letecia has been in this business for six years now.

Letecia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 43 years old and both of her children are in school.

Leonora has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Leonora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Milaluna

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Milaluna works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Milaluna is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

Milaluna has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Anely

texts.en:
Anely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional sack of rice to sell.

Anely has been in this business for five years. Anely earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sack of rice to sell.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Modesta works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Modesta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fruit and vegetables to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. Modesta hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school. She is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

Esperanza requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for eight years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Esperanza would like to save enough money that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es una mujer que actualmente tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y vive muy feliz mente con su familia, afortunadamente con la inversión que realizo le fue muy bien pues ahora su negocio ha incrementado sus mercaderías  y con ello sus ingresos han mejorado, Evangelina  ahora con sus ganancias ya pudo construir su casa y su familia ya vive en mejores condiciones, pero con el afán de seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías como cuadros, lamparas y recuerdos para su negocio de venta de regalos  y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Evangelina es poder contar con un local más grande para mejorar sus ingresos y que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a 27-year-old woman.  She is married and lives very happily with her family.  Fortunately, the investment that she made went very well. Now her business has increased merchandise and with that her income has improved.

With her earnings, Evangelina was able to build her house and her family lives in better conditions. But, with the desire to continue improving her family's quality of life, she is requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise such as picture frames, lamps and souvenirs for her gift-selling business and to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Evangelina's great dream is to be able to have a larger store to improve her income and that her children have better conditions in life.

loans.use: to buy picture frames, lamps and souvenirs

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Marichu works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Marichu is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

Marichu has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 47-year-old married mother of five children. She is living happily with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Sakina owns an embroidery business. She has been selling embroidery materials for many years. She sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles, and wooden frames for embroidery.

Due to high costs, Sakina is facing a shortage of materials and is unable to purchase expensive raw materials to sell. Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, Sakina will buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones, and pearls of various colors. Sakina is very thankful to the Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, bean and sorghum seeds, and fertilizers and insecticides in order to be able to sow a larger crop of basic grains and reap a better harvest.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She earns additional income from raising pigs and farming rice. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Eden is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Eden dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 44 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Mylene is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mylene has been farming coconut for 10 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 45 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Judy has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, shirts, bras, shorts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Judy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Judy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, shirts, bras, shorts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 40-year-old married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Wilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. 

Wilma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 62 years old, married, and has five children. He is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Wilfredo has a fish vending business in the Philippines. He has been in this business for ten years.

Wilfredo requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell. In the future, he would like to save enough money to expand his business and repair his family home.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Marilyn earns additional income from farming rice.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sehar Group

texts.en:
Sehar is the age of 29 and lives in Lahore with her family. Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He has been using salon instruments for many years and the worn out instruments need to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments but his financial condition does not allow him to do so.

Due to his low purchasing power, Sehar requested a loan so that her husband can become empowered and easily buy new instruments such as plastic chairs, a front mirror and hair cutting equipment.

Sehar hopes that this loan will work positively and she will be able to make some savings for household expenses. Sehar thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs, a front mirror and hair cutting equipment for her husband.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is a 58-year-old married woman with five children (one child is in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

Evelina requested a 24,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy materials like thread, needles, chalk, etc., for her tailoring business. In the future, Evelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, needles, chalk, etc., for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Emelita works hard to support her family.

She has a welding shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Emelita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like iron, plain sheet, welding rod, etc for her welding shop.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like iron, plain sheet, welding rod, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 47 years old. married and has seven children.  Three of her children are in school.

Salvacion does vegetable farming in the Philippines. He requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF, in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Salvacion has been farming vegetables for twenty years, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Helconida

texts.en:
Helconida is 60 years old and widowed with eight children. 

Helconida is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Helconida requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF, to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.  She has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Helconida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maua

texts.en:
Maua, a mother of three school-aged daughters, is married and is in her mid-forties. She fights day after day for her daughters in order to give them a better future and a quality education. 

Maua has supported her family with a beauty salon business for three years now. She is at her business from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

Maua is requesting her first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy salon hair products. She dreams of managing a big modern salon business to rise more income.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products

loans.name: Mae Jhazel

texts.en:
Mae Jhazel is 23 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mae Jhazel has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mae Jhazel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mae Jhazel has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mae Jhazel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is so grateful that she previously accessed a loan which she used to pay for the repair and maintenance of her Jeepney unit. Her earnings helped cover her family's personal, household and business expenditures. Although their life is hard in the Philippines, she believes that with both her and her husband's perseverance, life will get better for them. 

Marilyn trusts that she can again access a 19,000 PHP loan to pay for the annual registration of her Jeepney and for the continuous maintenance her unit. It is important that her Jeepney is always in good running condition to ensure safe and efficient service. She values her transportation business since it's their only means to earn a living. Marilyn is thanking God and you for your good heart. 

Marily's simple dream is to see all of her children finish school and become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the registration and maintenance of her Jeepney.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, no tiene  parientes que le ayuden económicamente para cubrir los gastos familiares, tiene su propio negocio de cultivar maíz desde hace 8 años, cuando recoge la cosecha almacena lo suficiente para alimentar a su familia y otra parte lo destina para vender y de tal manera tener ingresos económicos con los que puede cubrir los gastos familiares, es un oficio que heredó de su familia y las dificultades las tiene cuando hace mal clima.
Ya es temporada de siembra y ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo en insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz y tener una cosecha de calidad, tendrá oportunidad de ampliar el área de cultivo y mantenerse trabajando en lo que es su fuente de ingresos principal.
Sus sueños son tener mejores ingresos para comprar ganado para producir lácteos y tener mejor alimentación familiar.
texts.en:
Manuel, who lives with his wife and his children, does not have relatives to help him out financially in covering household expenses. He started his own corn-growing business eight years ago. When he collects his harvest, he stores enough to support his family, and the rest he sells in order to have an income to cover household expenses. It's a trade he inherited from his family, in addition to the difficulties he has during bad weather.

Now it's time to sow, and he has asked for a loan in order to invest in farming supplies for planting corn to have a high-quality harvest. He will have the opportunity to increase the area he cultivates as well as to continue working in his main source of income. 

His dream is to have better profits in order to buy cattle to produce milk and better food.

loans.use: to invest in farming supplies in order to sow corn and have a high-quality harvest.

loans.name: Segundo Cesar

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 46 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos pertenece a la ventanilla Yana Yacu que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en Guaranda Comunidad Pucarapamba en la provincia de Bolivar.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado ya que se dedica a la cria de animales y a la agricultura gracias a este crédito podra mejorar en el negocio su sueño es tener un terreno propio para no arrendar y tener mas ganacias, en su tiempo libre le gusta trotar.
texts.en:
Segundo is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. He belongs to the service point Yana Yacu, where members work in agriculture and live in the Guaranda Pucarapamba community in the province of Bolivar. 

He asks for this loan in order to buy cattle. He already makes his living raising animals and in agriculture. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to improve his business. His dream is to have his own plot of land so he doesn't have to rent, and to have better profits. In his free time, he likes to jog.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, nails and wood to finish replacing her home's roof.

loans.name: Klever Eduardo

texts.es: Klever tiene 33 años de edad es soltero vive solo en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la Comunidad Pucarapamba, el es Licenciado en enfermeria y se dedica a la agricultuta, solicita el crédito para invertir en la siembra de papas para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, con la facilidad del crédito podra mejorar su cosecha y nejorar su estilo de vida, su sueño es comprarse un carro y tener mas sembrios de papas, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y visitar a la familia.
texts.en: Klever is 33 years old. He is single and lives in Guaranda, province of Bolivar, in the Pucarapamba community. Klever has a degree in nursing and works in agriculture. He is requesting a loan to invest in planting potatoes. He will buy manure and fertilizers with help from the loan to improve his harvest and improve his lifestyle. His dream is to buy a car and have more potato fields. In his free time he likes to play sports and visit family.

loans.use: to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Las Inolvidables Group

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 28 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de dulces y refrescos hervidos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ ubicado a 20 kilómetros de la ciudad, se caracteriza por su riqueza artesanal en arcilla y produce principalmente; vasijas, macetas para plantas y otros artículos que son para uso del lugar. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Martha es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física delgada,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la segunda de la izquierda, lleva a su bebe en brazos). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como constructor, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no cuenta con alcantarillado. La necesidad de pagar los gastos de su bebé la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de huevo, reparación de celulares, venta de medicina natural, venta de fruta, artesanía en cerámica y venta de desayunos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de dulces y refrescos hervidos tradicionales como; Somó y chicha, que son bebidas refrescantes hervidos a base de harina de maíz y otra a base de maní, agregándole azúcar. Su actividad la desarrolla durante toda la semana en su puesto de venta fijo; “mi negocio me deja cuidar a mi bebé y es por eso que necesito mejorarlo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital de trabajo para comprar galletas para mejorar el negocio. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de galletas para mejorar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de galletas para vender en su negocio de refrescos para pagar los gastos de su bebe.
texts.en:
Martha is a married 28-year old woman. She has a two-year-old child and her business is selling sweets and soft drinks.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, caring, sensitive, sincere, responsible and very hard working. She does business in the town of Cotoca which is located 20 kilometers from the city. It is characterized by its rich clay crafts and produces mainly vessels, pots for plants and other articles for home use. It has subtropical warm weather with a temperature varying between 21 and 35 degrees Centigrade during the day. 

Martha has dark skin, brown eyes, long black hair which she wears tied behind her neck. She is short with a slender physical frame. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks at home and speaks Spanish because of the general culture and because of the type of business she conducts (the second from the left, holding a baby in her arms). She shares her life with her husband who is a construction worker. They live in rented room made of wood with a corrugated metal roof and a dirt floor. It has electricity and water that is extracted from a well by pump. It doesn’t have a sewage system. 

Needing to pay expenses for her baby, she led a group of people with businesses such as: food sales, egg sales, cell phone repair, natural medicine sales, fruit sales, ceramic artisanal products and breakfast sales, in order to request a loan and improve their activities. 

Her business is selling sweets and traditional soft drinks like Somó and chicha, which are soft drinks in a base of corn flour and another with a base of peanuts, adding sugar. She carries out this activity during the whole week in her fixed vending stall. “My business allows me to care for my baby and that is why I need to improve it…” she says. The advantage of her business is that it makes sales daily. The disadvantage is that the lack of money in her business to be able to buy cookies to improve her business. 

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in 2 years she has developed this business.

For these reasons, Martha is requesting a loan to buy cookies to sell in her soft drink business to be able to pay her baby’s expenses.

loans.use: para la compra de galletas para vender en su negocio de refrescos para pagar los gastos de su bebe.

loans.name: Nancy Veronica

texts.es:
Nancy, es casada, vive con su esposo de 37 años de edad y un hijo de 11 años de edad, la pareja comparte la responsabilidad de disminuir las necesidades familiares, por su parte ella tiene actualmente una venta de ropa usada y labora como secretaría en un laboratorio clínico, al realizar estas actividades puede generar ingresos para cubrir gastos de su hogar.
Es un negocio que debe estar debidamente surtido, por tal razón requiere de un crédito para comprar fardos de ropa para adultos y niños/as, será de ayuda para ofrecer prendas de vestir variadas y con precios accesibles, espera que las ventas aumenten y le dejen mayores ganancias.
Las aspiraciones de Nancy son que su hijo se mantenga estudiando y culmine una carrera universitaria, en cuanto a su negocio seguirá trabajando para que crezca.
texts.en:
Nancy is married and lives with her 37-year-old husband and 11-year-old son. The couple share the responsibility for the household expenses. She currently has a business selling used clothes and also works as a secretary in a clinical laboratory. With this work she can generate income to cover her household expenses. 

This business has to be well stocked which is why she is requesting a loan to buy bundles of adult and children's clothing. This will help her provide varied and affordable clothing. She hopes her sales will increase and leave her higher profits. 

Nancy's hopes are that her son will keep studying and will culminate in a university degree. As to her business, she will continue working so that it will grow.

loans.use: to buy bundles of adult and children's clothing  which will help her provide varied and affordable clothing.

loans.name: Miladis Patricia

texts.es: Miladis en su Salón de Belleza, ofrece un agradable y acogedor servicio en el que el cliente tiene la plena confianza de estar en buenas manos.  Con quince años de experiencia  brinda una toda una variada gama de servicios de estética y cuidado personal; cortes de cabello, tinturaciones, queratinas y demás tratamientos capilares a la vanguardia, depilaciones, limpiezas faciales y masajes corporales.  Su idea de negocio surgió al haberse capacitado en este arte y sus instructores le recomendaron adecuar un espacio en su vivienda, tiempo después tuvo que arrendar un local para poder cubrir la cobertura puesto que su negocio había sido todo un éxito.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para mejorar los enseres de su local al adquirir una silla de peluquería, un mueble y un aire acondicionado.  Esta inversión permitirá ofrecer mejor confort a sus clientes, así mismo más afluencia de personas dispuesta a gozar de sus servicios.  Miladis de 38 años, reside con sus hijos y su cónyuge en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla y su meta familiar es adquirir sus casa propia, así mismo en sus negocio desea continuar trabajando comprometida para a futuro comprar su local.
texts.en:
Miladis offers pleasant and friendly service from her beauty parlor, where the customer has complete confidence of being in good hands. With fifteen years of experience, she offers a wide variety of services in aesthetics and personal care: hair cuts, hair coloring, keratins and other cutting-edge hair treatments, waxing, facials, and body massages.

Her business idea emerged after having trained in this art and her instructors recommended her to adapt a space in her home. Sometime later she had to rent a place in order to be able to meet demand because her business had become a success.

At present she is applying for a loan, first financing done through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ["Foundation of Mario Santo Domingo"], in order to improve the equipment of her place by purchasing a hairdresser's chair, a cabinet, and an air conditioner. This investment will provide better comfort to her customers, also more influx of people ready to enjoy her services.

Miladis, age 38, resides with her children and her spouse in a neighborhood to the south of Barranquilla. Her goal for her family is to purchase their own home, also in their business she wishes to continue working committed for a future to buy her location.

loans.use: to purchase a hairdresser's chair, a cabinet, and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a permanent toilet.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a capable woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1970 and is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. 

She is one of IMON’s startup clients who participated at a three day training of “How to start a new business and achieve success”. She got the necessary information and knowledge to come to idea that it would help her to earn money for living. 

She was interested in a business in serving Tajik woman with traditional dresses.  She is willing to serve and help her residents in village with beautiful national dresses. She is asking financial support to buy a sewing machine. She awaits Kiva lenders support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to make traditional Tajik women's dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 45 years old and married with two children.

Anabelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Anabelle has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from purified water retail.

Anabelle aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sutriono

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is one of Ruma's agents, Sutriono. He just joined Ruma last year. 

Sutriono lives in Sumedang, located in West Java, about 4-5 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two children, one daughter and one son. He owns a stall where he sells small snacks and mobile airtime credits and provides electricity bill payment service for his community. He decided to join Ruma last year because he wanted to become an entrepreneur as well as to provide more contribution to his community. Sutriono is really excited to be a part of Ruma’s network because it is something new for him. His community sees him as a trusted and informed mobile provider.

Right now, he is requesting a Kiva loan to help him to purchase more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services for his community. 

Sutriono is seen in the photo. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide bill payment service and sell mobile airtime credits so his village community has a better access to communication and financial services.

loans.name: Armenak

texts.en:
Armenak, 44, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Akhalkalaki district in Georgia. The family has no source of income, Armenak and his wife are unemployed.

Armenak is a very enthusiastic man who wishes to be financially independent. He wants go into business with the help of a 1,000 USD loan from Kiva's field partner MFO Credo. He owns a car and wants to trade in fruits and vegetables in the local community.

Armenak’s loan application has been approved within the framework of a startup program that enables inexperienced borrowers to begin new businesses. This loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Armenak’s family and give them financial stability. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
Musa is 32 years old, married, and has a young son who is in school. He runs a variety of businesses. He moves cargo from different towns to upcountry, renting other people's vans to run his business as he doesn't have a van. His other businesses are motorbikes for transportation, house renting, and local water commonly known as Kandoro. He is a really a hard working father of one son. He has business assistants, works from 6am until midnight, and is able to make a great profit.

His desire is to be able to manage his own vans for transit so that he can prevent customer complaints, especially about loss of cargo, and also reduce costs. This is his fourth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania; all of the previous loans were paid back successfully. He used the previous credit to improve his water business by serving more people. He used his profits to cover school fees for his son, provide for family needs, and reinvest in his business. 

Musa will invest part of this new credit to put electricity in one of his houses for renting. He will share this loan with his group, Tupendane B, consisting of two men who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to put electricity in one of his houses for renting.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua  is a mother of four kids, one boy and three girls. She is 40 years old  and married. She has been a tailor for five years now and is able to make a good profit each month. Perpetua starts working at 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. daily. 

This is her third credit from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy materials for making clothes. She dreams to own a big business. Perpetua will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 54 years old and widowed with six children. With four children still in school, Trinidad works very hard to provide for them.

Trinidad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, cereals, etc., to sell.

Trinidad has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Trinidad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, cereals, etc., to sell

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is aged 33 years old. She is a responsible mother of a son and a daughter. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of eight persons. 

Saba is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people, at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Saba is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Saba is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, spools, needles, buttons and laces for her sewing business

loans.name: Berlie

texts.en:
Berlie is 30 years old and married with one child.

Berlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Berlie has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from direct selling Avon products.

Berlie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Domestica

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Domestica works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of eggs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Domestica is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell for her egg business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell for her business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 38-year-old Ugandan man who lives in Bundibugyo. He deals in motorcycle transportation, together with cocoa buying and selling. This business has helped him in providing for his family.

He wants a loan to buy cocoa for selling. He has realized a lot of profits from the previous loan, which he invested very well. He is very hard-working and wants to expand his business further.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Christian Joy

texts.en:
Christian Joy is single and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Christian Joy requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business. She has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Christian Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Raquela

texts.en:
Raquela is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Raquela is 38 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Raquela has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Raquela requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Raquela has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Raquela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears like fishing net, fish containers, gasoline, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Deyaa-Aldeen

texts.en: Deyaa-Aldeen is 22 years old. He is living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his family, which consists of four siblings and his parents. He is studying for a Bachelor's degree, majoring in plant production. He is in his fourth year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation. He will do this in order to start supporting his family financially, as they are facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou is 58 years old and a married mother of six children. She is a head of a village in Kratie province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she has been growing rice on 2.5 hectares of farmland as the main source of her family’s income for 40 years. Growing cassava is an additional source of income for her family. She can earn about 40,700KHR per day. 

Her crop did not grow well last year because of drought. It has affected her daily income and now she does not have enough funds to do farming this year. Thou is applying for her first Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay the plowing fee. She hopes to gain more yields through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old, married man from Jabalia city. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. 

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to decrease the electricity expenses. Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Eliodora

texts.en: Eliodora is a mother of three children and has invested in the rice retail business for almost 15 years. She does this work to support her children. She asked for a loan to purchase a trailer for the rice field. Owning another one will increase her income and she would be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for the rice field

loans.name: Hòa

texts.en:
Mrs Hòa is 41 years old, and she is married. She operates a food stall where she has been selling fish for more than 10 years. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoá province. Her family household is low-income in a village where the market demand is low in this region. 

Mrs Hòa's family is drinking water that is too saline. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase a water filter machine.

In 2015, Mrs Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has already successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profits, Mrs Hòa hopes for her business to do well. She hopes to earn enough money to provide for her kids and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, canned goods, noodles and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is 68 years old and married. She lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. For the past 10 years, Florencia has been a farmer. Florencia is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 56 years old with 10 children. Letecia personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. Recently, she availed a loan to  purchase a new fishing boat.In the future, she wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia operates a retail Ready To Wear (clothing) and dry goods business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to buy additional RTW stock. She wants to restock clothing, socks and towels to sell. She dreams of expanding her business area and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional RTW clothing stock for her business.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen is 51 years old and he lives in Kapan city with his nice family. He has school-aged son and daughter. Vazgen has a large background of working experience. He graduated from Yerevan State Agricultural University and has a degree in the field of mechanical engineering in the rural sphere. Now Vazgen is working as an electrician.

Besides his job, Vazgen is a farmer. Vazgen has a large plot of land where he cultivates grain, potatoes, cabbage, cucumbers and beans and in his large orchard he receive a good harvest of apples, pears, cherries and mulberries and all this products he sells in the fruit and vegetable markets of Kapan city.  He appreciates his farming and with the profit of his agricultural business he is able to solve all his family needs, and pays for his children's education. 

Vazgen asks Kiva and Nor Horizon for a loan of 300,000 AMD in order to buy a diesel fuel for his wheat field and to pay for the mechanization costs of his farming.

loans.use: to buy a diesel fuel for his wheat field and to pay for the mechanization costs of his farming

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Flor works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of personal collection items business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Flor is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to  buy more personal care products to sell to her customers.

Ma. Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 25 ans, Martine est une femme mère de deux  enfants. Martine habite à Adidogomé et vend des chaussures en se promenant dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Martine s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local de Lomé. Pour commander des cartons de chaussures, Martine demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Martine is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells shoes by walking through the neighborhood. She does this to earn the income necessary for her family to thrive. To meet her needs, she buys supplies two times a month in the local market in Lomé. 

Martine is asking for this loan so that she can order her boxes of shoes. The income she earns will allow her to help her husband with their children's education.

loans.use: buy seven boxes of shoes.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.en: Ilda lives in Dili. Her business is to buy vegetables and fruits and resell them to the market. She started her business with her own capital of $400 in 2011. She is requesting a loan of $600 to help her increase her capital. She will be buying more vegetables such as vegetables, watermelon, and potatoes to resell. She happy to doing her business, because it's become her activity and she also can be improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, watermelon, and potatoes to resell

loans.name: Thư

texts.en:
Mrs Thư is 41 years old and married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years. Thư lives in Hoang Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoá province. Her family is a low-income household living in a village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

In 2015, Thư joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thư has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to drink. Her family is drinking water that has salinity. She is requesting a loan to purchase a clean water filter machine.

Thư hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business with her business profit.

loans.use: to purchase a clean water filter machine .

loans.name: Shirley
