texts.en: Shirley lives in Tipan, Oroquieta and supports her children by building houses from the ground up. She applied a  loan to buy building material and paint, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material and paint and pay her workers.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José tiene la necesidad de invertir nuevamente en la ganadería y la agricultura, por lo que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar concentrado para alimentar el ganado e insumos agrícolas para preparar el terreno y sembrar granos básicos, la idea de José es seguir mejorando su negocio con la ayuda de créditos.
Con el financiamiento anterior pudo darle un buen trato a sus cultivos teniendo así una mayor cosecha y otra parte le sirvió para mejorar la ganadería, actualmente su familia se mantiene igual y las circunstancias de vida son más confortables.
texts.en:
José has the need to invest again in cattle and farming, for which he is applying for a new loan to buy cattle feed and fertilizer to prepare the land and plant staple foods, José’s idea is to keep improving his business with the help of loans. 

With the previous loan he was able to give his crops good treatment thus having a better harvest and another part helped him improve the livestock, currently his family remains the same and the circumstances of life are more comfortable.

loans.use: buy cattle feed and fertilizer to prepare the land and plant staple foods.

loans.name: Bawang Putih Group

texts.en:
Antonia, a 28-year-old woman, is a leader of the Bawang Putih Group. She is married to Heribertus, a 26-year-old man. They are blessed with a daughter, 8 months old, named Maria. Antonia runs a public transport business (called “bemo”) with her husband as the driver. Antonia (who is standing in the middle) bought a vehicle for the transport business in installments. She is thinking of paying it off ahead of schedule, but she needs more money to do so. 

Antonia and her neighbors were introduced to the TLM group loan program by an account officer. Four women were interested in joining the loan program, so Antonia formed a group and applied for a loan totaling of IDR 15,000,000 at TLM. Antonia plans to use her part to pay the installment of the vehicle, while other women will use their money for their own businesses such as selling kerosene, vegetables, a kiosk business and livestock. They hope Kiva – TLM will assist them for their better lives in the future.

loans.use: to pay the “Bemo” installment

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en: Gemmalyn has considerable preparations for the post harvest operations of her coconuts in Aloran. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took a loan. Gemmalyn hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Wendtongo Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOLANGE est responsable du groupe  WENDTONGO. Mariée elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 14 ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans. Les 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle à 04 personnes en charge.
Madame fait la couture depuis 09 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter une (01) machine à coudre.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne aider son mari à payer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Madame Solange is the leader of the Wendtongo group. She is married and the mother of two children between the ages of six and 14. Two of her children go to school and she has four additional dependents. 

She has been a seamstress for nine years. She buys her supplies in the neighboring markets. 

With the money she earns, she would like to buy a sewing machine. She would like to use the income from her loan to grow her business. She would like to help her husband with her children's schooling fees.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es: Juana tiene 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 11 y 3 años de edad por los cuales trabajan para brindarles sus estudios y salir adelante. Juana se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo para diferentes instituciones y además vende ropa en las comunidades cercanas a su vivienda con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Juana se siente muy agradecida ya que anteriormente obtuvo un crédito  para hacer cambio al techo de su vivienda pero  solo logro hacerlo en una parte ya que el  monto no le alcanzo para realizar el cambio de techo completamente, por lo que ella solicita un crédito nuevo a FUSAI para la compra de lámina, clavos y madera para poder terminar el cambio de  techo de su casa y brindar así una mayor protección y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Juana is 28 years old. She lives in her own home along with her partner and their two children, who are 11 and 3 years old. She works hard to give them an education and get them ahead. Juana sells a variety of catalog products and to increase her income she also sells clothing in the communities surrounding her home. Juana is very grateful because she has received a previous loan to replace the roof of her house, but she was only able to complete part of the project and the loan amount was not sufficient to replace the entire roof. This is why she requests a new loan from FUSAI to purchase laminate, nails and wood to be able to finish replacing her roof. This will provide greater protection and a higher quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en: Agnes is a mother of three children who are in school. She is in her mid-40s, supporting her  family by running a grocery store selling beer, sodas, waters, and spirits. She has been managing the business for 15 years now. Agnes runs her business from 6 am until after midnight and is able to make a good profit each month. This is her second loan via Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy stocks of drinks (beer, sodas, and water). She dreams of expanding her grocery business and owning a car. She will share this loan with her loan group "Mshikamano," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of drinks (beer, sodas, and water) for her grocery store.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 65 years old and married. She lives in Villafor, Oroquieta City. For the past 20 years, Luzminda has been a farmer. She earns a meager income of 1,500 PHP each month ding this type of work. 
Luzminda is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to yield more harvest. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to yield more harvest

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is 50 years old, and lives alone in Batumi, Georgia.  Iamze is unemployed and decided to open a shop and requested a loan.  The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to obtain a loan to open a shop.  

With the received credit Iamze will open an ecclesiastical shop in Batumi and will generate a stable income. Iamze will sell in newly opened shop candles, icons other handmade ecclesiastical things. She hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open ecclesiastical shop

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta is a young lady living in Liquica. In 2014, she started a business shop with $500. In her shop she sells items such as biscuits, eggs, candies, tea, candies, including soft drinks and hard drinks and  other things to sell. She restocks her shop very often because she doesn't have enough money to make her shop full of items. She is now requesting a loan of $1000.00 to help her restock her shop to its potential. She hopes that with this loan, she won't have to leave her business very often and she will make a lot of revenue.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, eggs, candies, tea, candies, including soft drinks and hard drinks and  other things to sell..

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda started her business in 2013 with her own working capital of $800.00. She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have good management for her business. 

So, she has one idea to request a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management, because she said with borrowed money she could count the income and expenditure in one day. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as cooking oils, milk, gambling cards, noodles, lighters, candy, slippers, water, including soft drinks and other things to sell. 

She has been busy with her business, and she is happy to do that.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, milk, gambling cards, noodles, lighters, candy, slippers, water, including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita works hard to support her family. Jovita is married and has a buy and sell of sweet cashew nuts business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like cashew nuts, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Jovita has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Jovita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like cashew nuts, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 25 ans et vit à Baguida avec son  enfant. Pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, Akossiwa vend du riz pour gagner la rentabilité nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Akossiwa s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de riz et tirer plus de profits, Akossiwa demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leur enfant.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is 25 years old, married, and lives in Baguida with her child. In order to meet her family's needs, she sells rice. This helps her reach the profitability required for her family to thrive.

Akossiwa buys her supplies in the market five times a month. She is asking for this loan in order to buy bags of rice and earn more income. She wants to meet her goals in order to help her husband with their child's education.

loans.use: buy three bags of rice.

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly is indeed thankful and encouraged that she again was granted a 12,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Her small store helps with their daily sustenance. Typical of Filipino women, she finds ways and means to augment her income to give her family a better life. Aside from her general store, she is blessed to have put up a small resort that has one cottage and has ornamental plants that she also sells.

With her new business, she hopes that you will again grant her a PHP 19,000 loan to buy different kinds of ornamental plants to sell. Part of the loan she will use to renovate her cottage to make her resort more inviting and pleasing to families who want to take a break on weekends from their busy lives. She values all her businesses for they are where they get funds to cover their everyday needs and the school needs of her children.

Rosaly's simple dream is to do more landscaping and improve her resort to attract more clients. She also desires that all her children will go to college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies. .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various  ornamental plants and improve her resort as well.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, se encuentra acompañado y no tiene hijos, administra una tienda y ofrece el servicio de motorista para hacer viajes, el oficio lo aprendió con la ayuda amistades, con la experiencia necesaria decidió tener su propio negocio para ir mejorando la situación económica familiar.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de golosinas, bebidas, boquitas, etc., para surtir el inventario de su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes, otra parte del dinero lo destinara para renovar sus documentos personales y seguir ofreciendo el servicio de motorista, espera que las ganancias sean mayores y pueda resarcir la deuda sin problemas.
Sus sueños son ampliar el negocio, mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y tener menos necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
José has a partner and no children. He runs a store and offers his services doing trips by motorbike. He learnt how to do this job with this help of his friends and when he had the experience he needed he decided to open his own store to improve his family's financial situation.

José will use this loan to buy lollies, drinks, snacks, etc. to restock his store's inventory and better serve his customers. Another part of the money from this loan will be used to renew his personal documents and continue offering his motorbike service. He hopes to increase his earnings so he can repay his debt without any problems.

José dreams of expanding his store, improving the infrastructure of his home and having less family needs to meet.

loans.use: to buy lollies, drinks, snacks, etc. to restock his store's inventory

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Abla travaille  activement pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Abla vend de la pate bandée accompagnée de viandes en parcourant tout son quartier afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Abla achète ses provisions quatre fois par mois sur un marché local du quartier et demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de pate et des cartons de viandes. Abla souhaite maximiser son profit et permettre l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abla is married and lives in Baguida with her four dependent children. She works to make sure her children thrive. 

In order to meet their needs, Alba sells "pate bandée" (a food made from corn) along with meats. She walks throughout the neighborhood in order to make a profit. She buys her supplies four times a month in the local market. 

She is asking for this loan to buy bowls and boxes of meat. Alba would like to maximize her profit and allow her children to thrive.

loans.use: buy 160 bowls and three boxes of meat.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer de 54 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija independiente, y su negocio es la agricultura.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, optimista, generosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en ‘Jatun pampa’ que se encuentra en una zona de gran potencial agrícola, principalmente de la producción de patata. De clima templado durante todo el año con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 15-28 grados centígrados.
Hilda es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Qhechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su nieta que estudia en la escuela, Viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. El lugar dónde vive es una zona alejada rural, actualmente se realizaron nuevas conexiones de agua para el lugar, “en este lugar nunca hemos tenido agua potable, me gustaría que mi nieta crezca en mejores condiciones de vida…” comenta. La ventaja de su zona es que ya cuenta con acceso a agua potable, la desventaja es la falta de capital para instalación de agua potable en la cocina, baño y lavandería. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su hogar, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su nieta deje de beber agua sucia de pozo.Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en toda su vida que vive en el área rural.
Es por esos motivos que Hilda solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su nieta deje de beber agua sucia de pozo.
texts.en:
Hilda is 54 years old. She is single and has a grown daughter. Hilda works in agriculture. She is entrepreneurial, independent, stable, optimistic, generous, patient, responsible and a very hard worker. 
She works in 'Jatun pampa' which is located in a very fertile agricultural area where potatoes are the primary crop. With a temperate climate year-round, and a temperature which varies each day between 15 and 28 degrees Centigrade. 
Hilda has a tan complexion, brown eyes and long black hair which she braids. She is short and in robust health. She wears traditional clothing, including a hat, shawl and skirt. Her native language is Quechua which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish around town and in her business.
She shares her life with her granddaughter who is in school. They live in the home Hilda owns, which is built of wood with an iron roof and earth floor. The house has electricity and has water from a well, which is extracted through a pump. 
They live in a remote, rural area where they are currently installing a public water system. Hilda says "in this place we have never had drinkable water, and I would like it if my granddaughter could grow up in better conditions". The advantage of their area is that they have access to drinkable water, the disadvantage is that she lacks the money to bring this water into her kitchen, bathroom and washroom. 
Hilda's dream is to have plumbing in her home, and she wants to install it in the kitchen, bathroom and washroom so that her granddaughter no longer has to drink dirty water from the well. For the first time in all the time she has lived in this area, Hilda has taken on a loan with this institution. She has requested the loan to install plumbing in her kitchen, bathroom and washroom so that her granddaughter doesn't have to drink well water.

loans.use: to install plumbing in her home.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Roselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, soap, noodles, eggs, etc. for her general store business.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, soap, noodles, and eggs

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 40 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of kitchenware in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of kitchenware to sell.

Melisa has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of kitchenware business for nine years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling of personal collection products business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of personal collection products like lotion, body soap, etc. to sell to her customers.

Luzviminda has been in this business for three years. Luzviminda earns more income from buying and selling silver jewelry.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of personal collection products like lotion, body soap, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Isabel works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from direct selling of tupperware products. Isabel is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Wilver Antonio

texts.es:
Wilver, realiza su negocio en el campo, cultivando maíz, lo tiene desde hace 10 años, lo inicio con capital propio y con esfuerzos lo ha podido ampliar, vive en casa familiar con su esposa y tres hijos de 16, 11 y 10 años de edad, solamente él trabaja para tener ingresos en su hogar.
El crédito que ha solicitado lo invertirá en insumos agrícolas y semilla mejorada de maíz, tendrá todos los materiales necesario para sembrar y obtener una cosecha de calidad, espera lograr abastecer a su familia y a sus clientes para que sus ganancias sean mayores.
Sus sueños son ser un agricultor potencial en la zona y ofrecer a su familia una vida con menos carencias.
texts.en:
Wilver's business is in the fields, growing corn. He began this work 10 years ago with his own capital and through his efforts he has been able to expand his business. He lives in the family home with his wife and three children who are 16, 11 and 10 years old. He is the only one who works and brings home an income.  

The loan that Wilver has applied for will be used to buy agricultural supplies and improved corn seeds so that he will have all the necessary items to plant and obtain a quality harvest. He hopes to have enough for his family and his customers so that he can obtain greater earnings. 

Wilver's dream is to be a key agricultural figure in the region and offer his family a life of less scarcity.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and improved corn seeds so that he will have all the necessary items to plant and obtain a quality harvest

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elnora works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Elnora is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish for her dried fish making business.

Elnora has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maricel is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maricel has a direct selling of Tupperware and personal collection products business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maricel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Karen Lisbeth

texts.es: Karen en su restaurante ubicado en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, ofrece deliciosos platos típicos de la Región Caribe; desayunos y almuerzos corrientes.  A partir de las 7 a.m. sus clientes pueden degustar de desayunos como huevos revueltos encebollados,  arepa dulce, café con leche o jugo de naranja recién extraído, esta es una muestra de las deliciosas comidas elaboradas por Karen que cuenta con una variada carta de comidas gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre quien se ha dedicado a la culinaria toda su vida.  Cada vez son más los clientes que desean probar de estos platos y para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en compra de víveres al por mayor y poder recibir descuentos.  Su meta a futuro es comprar su propio apartamento para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus tres hijos menores de edad y en su negocio planea incrementar las ventas para el próximo año.
texts.en:
In her restaurant located in a suburb in the Barranquilla area, Karen serves delicious dishes typical of the Caribbean region, both breakfasts and set lunches. From 7am her customers can try her breakfasts which include scrambled eggs and onion, sweet arepas, cafe latte or freshly squeezed orange juice. This is a sample of the delicious meals prepared by Karen from a varied menu, thanks to the teachings of her mother who was devoted to cooking all her life. There are always more and more customers who want to try Karen's dishes and this is why she is applying for a Kiva loan. 

This is this first loan Karen has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy groceries in bulk so she can get a discount. Her goal for the future is to buy her own apartment so she can give her three young children a better quality of life and increase sales in her business next year.

loans.use: to buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, tienen 1 hijo, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mutualista’ un área muy demandada por aquellos que quieren tener su tienda o negocio de cualquier tipo y al frente está el Mercado Mutualista que es muy visitado por compradores de toda la ciudad. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Karina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su bebé que tiene 1 año de edad y ya empieza a caminar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de empanadas; estas se caracterizan por estar rellenas de carne con cebolla y se acostumbra a comerlas a primera hora de la mañana y calientes. La rutina diaria comienza a las 7 de la mañana cuando ella ya se encuentra en la calle empujando su carrito de 2 ruedas cargando de 2 canastas cubiertas y envueltas en papel para que no se enfríe el contenido, porque los clientes acostumbran a comerlas calientes, llega a su puesto de venta y espera pacientemente a que los clientes lleguen, pocas horas después se acaba toda su comida. “mis empanadas se venden a diario, también quiero incursionar en la venta de postres…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos que acostumbran a comer sus empanadas a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos para aumentar su oferta. Su sueño es abrir un tienda de venta de todo tipo de empanas, ella desea invertir en la compra de insumos de cocina como harina, leche, huevos, levadura, queso, etc., para aumentar su producción y llegar a más clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Karina solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para la elaboración de empanadas para abrir una tienda de empanadas.
texts.en:
Karina is a 24 year old woman who is single, has a child and works selling empanadas. She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the Mutualista area which is very much in demand by those who want to have a a store like hers or any type of business. She works opposite the Mutualista market which is visited by many buyers from the whole city. The temperature of the warm subtropical climate varies from 21 to 35 degrees Celsius during the day. 

Karina has dark skin, brown eyes and long black hair which she ties up. She is short in stature and slight in build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family, speaking Spanish in general and for the business she runs. She shares her life with her baby who is one year old and is starting to walk. They live in a rented room which is made out of bricks and cement and has a corrugated iron roof, drinking water, electricity and a sewrage system.

Karina works selling empanadas. They are typically filled with meat and onion and are usually eaten hot first thing in the morning. Her daily routine starts at 7 in the morning when she can be found on the street pushing her two wheeled cart carrying two baskets which are covered and wrapped in paper so that the contents don't get cold, since her customers are used to eating them hot. Once she gets to her workplace she patiently waits for her customers to arrive. A few hours later all of her food runs out. “I sell my empanadas daily and I also want to start selling desserts", Karen says. The advantage of her business is that she has loyal customers who have become accustomed to eating her empanadas every day. The disadvantage is that she lacks the capital to buy ingredients to increase her product range. 

Karina's dream is to open a store where she can sell all kinds of empanadas. She would like to buy ingredients such as flour, milk, eggs, yeast, cheese, etc. to increase the amount she produces and attract more customers. This is the first loan cycle she has entered into with the institution in the one year that she has been working in this area. It is for this reason that Karina is applying for a loan to buy ingredients to make empanadas and open an empanada store.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make empanadas and open an empanada store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 48 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap.

Elvira has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the store for five years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Elvira aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items for her store

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Mary Ann has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Tulimubumwi Mbumbai Womens Group

texts.en:
Rehema is married with four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has been selling fish for 11 years now and also makes additional income from her cocoa gardens. She is a very hard working woman and has hopes of expanding her business. She faces the challenges of high competition in her area and price variability, but hopes for better in the future. 

Rehema would like this loan so she can pay her children's school fees and use the balance for expanding her business through buying more fish to sell. She is a member of Tulimubumwi Mbumbai women's group, through which members guarantee each other's loans.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 48 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Liliani was born in the seventies, and is married with four daughters who are at school. Since 1999, she has had a restaurant serving a variety of cooked foods like pilau, rice with meat, beans, vegetables, cooked banana, soup with chapati etc. She is doing very well, and is able to make a good profit per day. Liliani works hard, from 6am to midnight everyday. 

She has been with Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner, since 2008 and has been supported to grow her business. She now has plenty of working tools which enable her to serve more people than before. She used previous loans, paid back successfully, to buy cooking ingredients (sacks of rice, baking and maize flour, cooking oil, sugar etc) and managed to pay wages to her restaurant assistant in time. She also repaired her business premises with a new paint color and iron sheets. Liliani's dream is to open another branch and renovate the current branch. 

With the profit received, she plans to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family, and cover school fees and household expenses without difficulties. She will invest this credit in buying cooking ingredients for her business to enable her to serve more people. Liliani will share this credit with the three members from her group, Tumaini, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Liliani is so thankful for the support her lender has been showing to people.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her business to be able to serve more people.

loans.name: Yesenia María

texts.es: Yesenia de 36 años en compañía de sus dos hijos, reside en una vivienda ubicada en el  municipio de Barranquilla,  ella está dedicada a la venta de mercancías varias y comidas rápidas, su actividad laboral fue aprendida de su expareja y ha sido el sustento de su familia por muchos años.  Yesenia combina estas dos actividades muy bien, tanto que ha tenido éxito y su gama de productos es cada vez más diversa, ella comercializa prendas de vestir; jeans, pantalonetas, ropa íntima, y artículos de oferta de catálogos, así mismo en su venta de comidas rápidas elabora hamburguesas, perros calientes, sándwich y refrescos.  Como su carro de perros está muy deteriorado está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar un carro de perros nuevo y poder mejorar la imagen de su negocio y con ello mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo.  Su meta familiar es educar profesionalmente a sus hijos para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 36 years old and lives with her two children in Barranquilla municipality.

Yesenia works selling merchandise and fast food, trades that she learned from her ex-partner and which has supported her family for many years. 

Yesenia works at both her merchandise and fast food businesses very well. She has been successful in her work, and her range of products is becoming more diverse. Yesenia sells products such as clothing - jeans, trousers, underwear - and catalogue goods. At her fast food business, she sells hamburgers, hot dogs, sandwiches and soft drinks.

Now that her hot dog stand is not in such good condition, however, Yesenia is applying for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy a new hot dog stand and improve her business' image. This will allow Yesenia to improve her work. 

Yesenia's goal at home is to give her children an education so that they might learn a profession and enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a hot dog cart.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a hardworking 35-year-old woman with four children. She grows cocoa, dries it and sells it to both men and women in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Juliet works hard even if seasonal changes affect her yields, reducing her output and profit margin. She dreams of buying land of her own where she can do extensive farming without paying any rent. Juliet needs the loan to buy more cocoa to sell this peak season. She used the previous loan profitably to buy and sell cocoa.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell this peak season.

loans.name: Nourhan Group

texts.en:
Aida is the featured borrower for the Nourhan group. She got together with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they are working hard to develop their businesses and improve their living standards.

Aida is a 58-year-old Syrian refugee and a widowed mother, with twenty years of experience in tailoring and handicrafts work. She works hard to develop her skills to cover her children's expenses and needs. She is the sole breadwinner in her family, and she is trying with all her power and energy to improve her children’s social and financial situations to compensate for her husband’s absence. 

Today, through the acquired Al Majmoua loan, she wants to improve her business by buying necessary tailoring materials and newly released textiles, in addition to handicraft materials. She is the lady seated at the far right side of the picture. With respect to the other members of the group, Darine is a 33-year-old married mother of three children who wants to increase her merchandise by acquiring newly released accessories. She is the lady at the center of the picture with blond hair, while Sawsan is the first lady on the left.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying tailoring materials, newly released textiles and handicraft materials.

loans.name: Nihale

texts.en: Nihale is a 25 year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. Her parents are her main income source and she is pursuing her education. Today, she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her university fees. In the future, she is planning to work at a proper company to gain good experience in her field and at the same time earn enough income to be able to help her parents with the expenses.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Elanny

texts.en:
Elanny works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling food in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Elanny requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a 34-year-old woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a rattan business (used for furniture making) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Jonalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rattan to sell. In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rattan to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a smallholder farmer practising dairy farming to provide for her family. She enjoys dairy farming for it is her means of securing the basic necessities in life. This year, she is going a step further by starting crop farming.

In the Kapsowar area of Kenya, where Stella hails from, the population depends on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that their yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo partnered with KIVA to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers in Kapsowar can now buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use in their farms. 

Stella is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilisers, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business culturing seaweed in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, plastic rope and other materials.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, plastic rope and other materials.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and working in a general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a smallholder farmer practising dairy and banana farming to provide for her family. Her family is composed of her, her husband and two children. 

In the Nkubu area of Kenya, where Lucy hails from, the population depends on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. The major challenge is that there is a huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that yields and incomes for farmers in Nkubu are far below what they could be. 

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to increase access to financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through this partnership, Lucy is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to increase her production and fill the increasing demand for food. In the process, she will generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Emelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers. In the future, Emelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alexandr

texts.en:
Alexandr, 53 years old, is married and is from the region of Soroca. Alexandr works as a farmer and currently cultivates 14 hectares of land. Four hectares are his own property and 10 hectares are leased. He has sown eight hectares with soybean, one hectare with sunflowers, three hectares with wheat and two hectares with pumpkins. As his tractor is very old and requires frequent repairs, he has decided to sell it. He will use the money he gains from selling his old tractor to buy another newer and more efficient one. 

Alexandr is asking for a loan to help with the purchase of the tractor. Having a new tractor will enable him to cultivate his fields at the correct time of year, increase production and help create a sustainable income for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay for a tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bijeli

texts.en:
Bijeli is the mother of four children - one son and three daughters - who have finished schooling. She is in her late forties and single, and is taking care of her grandkids who are still in school. 

For six years now, Bijeli has made her living by running a mamalishe (street vendor) business selling rice, stiff porridge with meat, fish, vegetables and beans. Bijeli learned this business after her life seemed to be becoming hard, but still her mamalishe did not provide a satisfactory income. Later on, she introduced a local drinks (Komoni and Chibuku) business so as to increase her income. Now, she also manages another business selling local drinks like Komoni and Chibuku. She opens her business from 6am to 11pm each working day and is able to make a good profit per month. 

Bijeli used to be a client of Tujijenge a long time ago when the company commenced. She stopped taking loans after her drinks business had a high fall in sales. This is her fifth loan request since she has started taking loans again. She will use this loan to buy ten crates of local drinks and food ingredients for cooking including kilos of rice, sugar and beans. With her previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she used the funds to start her mamalishe business and restock the food items. Bijeli managed to earn an extra income which she used to buy a TV, radio and house sofa set, and covered school fees and home food expenses. 

She dreams that one day she will be able to build a nice family house and improve her business. She will held accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy ten crates of local drinks and food ingredients including rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is aged 50, married and blessed with three children. She has been selling fish and squid in her family's village for almost 19 years and earns a net income of PHP 18,000 a month. Her motorcycle is used to roam around her village and sell her fish immediately.

Due to insufficient capital in her business she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase fish and squid to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fish and squid to sell.

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
Tirso is grateful that he was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which helped grow his General Store.  He is glad that he can fulfill his responsibility to provide well for his family.

He trusts that he can now access a PHP 50,000 loan to expand his store and buy large quantities of grocery items. Although there are other general stores around his area he sees to it that he has a complete stock of essential food items so that people will prefer to buy at his store. With his faith in God and his family as his inspiration he faces life and its challenges with a positive and joyful attitude. He is thanking God and you in advance for continually supporting him. 

Tirso's simple dream is to sustain and grow his store so he can send all his three children to college and allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for his business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lilibeth has a business selling food in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like chicken, cooking oil, spices and flour for her food production business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like chicken, cooking oil, spices and flour for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sanaatkhan

texts.ru: Санаатхан, 58 лет, замужем, многодетная мама 5 детей. У Санаатхан- среднее образование, у нее очень большой трудовой стаж, последние 6 лет работает главным бухгалтером. Ежемесячная заработная плата- 8,165 сом (KGS), также получает пенсию - 4,600 сом (KGS). Санаатхан с супругом живут в собственном доме, в этом году она решила пристроить к дому летнюю кухню, и обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Свои доходы Санаатхан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий и проведение капитального ремонта дома.
texts.en: Sanaatkhan is 58 years old, married, a mother of five. Sanaatkhan has completed secondary education, she has a long work experience, for the last six years she's been working as a chief accountant. Her monthly salary is 8,165 som (KGS), she also receives retirement payments of 4,600 som (KGS). Sanaatkhan and her husband live in their own house, and this year she decided to build a summer kitchen. For this, she turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy construction materials. She plans to invest the borrowed money in improving her housing conditions and making major renovations in the house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a summer kitchen near her house

loans.name: Gulpasha

texts.ru: Гулпаша, 64 года, замужем, мать 3 детей, уже есть внуки. У нее среднее образование, занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Гулпаши имеется 0,55 ГА земельного надела, на котором она ежегодно выращивает картофель и клевер для реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулпаша обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коровы для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулпаша хочет вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку сарая.
texts.en: Gulpasha is 64 years old, married, a mother of three, has grandchildren. She has completed secondary education. Gulpasha cultivates plants and breeds animals for a living. Thanks to her hard work, she now has a 0.55 ha land lot where she cultivates potatoes and clover for sale. She also has 20 sheep in her household. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). To expand her household, Gulpasha turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow for fattening and resale. She plans to reinvest the future income in the business, and in building a barn.

loans.use: to purchase one cow for fattening and resale

loans.name: Victor Yoni

texts.es:
Victor Yoni tiene 35 años de edad, soltero, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familar en el distrito de Nanchoc , la cual es una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia de San Miguel, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú, que se dedica a la agricultura, la ganadería y el comercio mayormente.

Victor Yoni se dedica a brindar servicios fotocopiado, tipeos, impresiones con más de 02 años de expreciencia en el rubro, con buenas referencias laborales y perosnales, solicita prestamo para activo fijo;el matenimiento de su computadora de escritorio y de su fotocopiadora , además compra de accesorios para la implementacion de su local en donde presta sus servicio como asistente de programas sociales como digitador,con esto podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio lo que generará mayores ingresos por ende una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor Yoni, 35, is a single father to 3 children; he lives in his family home in the district of Nanchoc. It is a rural area within the San Miguel province, in the Cajamarca region of Sierra Norte, Peru, which is known mostly for agriculture, cattle raising and trade.

Victor Yoni makes a living by offering photocopy, typing and printing services. He has over 2 years of experience in this position and has good personal and professional references. Victor is requesting a loan for a fixed asset; the maintenance of his desktop computer and photocopier. He also wants to purchase accessories for his premises where he offers his typesetting services as an assistant for social programs. With this loan he will be able to provide a better service which will generate a better income and as such, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to service his desktop computer and photocopier, and purchase accessories for his office.

loans.name: Irma Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad.

Mariela, se dedica a la venta de pan, tamales, panes con pollo, etc. ella empezó en el negocio de las ventas desde que tenía 12 años de edad, aprendió todo gracias a su mamá y decidió dedicarse a las ventas porque siempre le gusto tener un negocio propio, el negocio está cerca de la casa, pero ella viaja en taxi porque tiene que llevar a su hijo mayor a la escuela y al pequeño a la guardería.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar productos para la venta como: pan dulce, pan francés, pollo, lechuga y hojas de plátano para los tamales etc.

Mariela, espera que su negocio crezca cada día más y poder colocar un nuevo local, con el cual podrá tener mayor acceso a clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Mariela is 25 years old, she studied up to 9th grade, she is in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture. She has two children of 6 and 2 years of age. Mariela makes a living selling bread, tamales, chicken sandwiches, etc...

She began in the sales business when she was 12 years old. She learned everything thanks to her mom and decided to make a living in sales because she always wanted to have her own business.

The business is near her house, but she commutes in a taxi because she has to take her older son to school and the younger one to the nursery.

The loan will be used for buying products for sale such as: pastries, French bread, chicken, lettuce and banana leaves for tamales, etc...

Mariela, hopes that her business grows more each day and that she is able to open a new place, with which she will be able to have greater access to new customers.

loans.use: to buy products for sale such as: pastries, French bread, chicken, lettuce and banana leaves for tamales, etc...

loans.name: William Ruben

texts.es: William tiene 27 años de edad es soltero vive con su madre en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Pucarapamba, pertenece a la ventanilla Rural Yana Yacu, el se dedica a la agricultura, a la produccion de leche, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera para obtener mayor porducción de leche y mejorar su situació económica, su sueño es mejorar su vivenda y la raza del ganado, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es el mal tiempo y el transporte, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: William is 27 years old, single and lives with his mother in Guaranda, Province of Bolivar, in the community of Pucarapamba. He belongs to the solidarity group Yana Yacu. He works in agriculture and milk production. For this he is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow in order to get more milk production and improve his financial situation. His dream is to improve his house and cattle breed. The challenges he faces are bad weather and transportation. In his free time he likes to practice sports.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Alya

texts.en: Alya is a 43-year-old married woman from Yata, a village near the city of Hebron. She has three sons and three daughters. Her sons work as construction workers, and their incomes are low. Alya opened a sewing workshop in her home, where she makes traditional clothing. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income. Alya took out a US Dollar loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop which will improve her work quality and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 36 year old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are still studying. Her husband is an employee of a company, and he is the family’s main source of income to improve the family’s standard of living. She is applying to take out a loan from Kiva’s partner Vitas s.a.l., to pay her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take out more Kiva loans to help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 32-year-old single man from Deir Al Balah City in the Gaza strip. He lives with his family in a small and humble house. Hani works part-time in  supermarket, where he earns a low income that barely covers all the family's needs. Hani decided to buy a rickshaw to use in distributing goods in the city in his free time. It is a good business and provides a good income. Hani took out a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transport goods between shops and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw to use in distributing goods in the city.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el caserío Patacón que pertenece al distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaen, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Pedro se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona; ademas brinda servicios de labores agrícolas como arado, batido de terrenos arroceros contando con yunta propia (2 toros), las actividades los realiza en el caserio de Patacon y caserios aledaños.

El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Pedro espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Pedro is 54 years old and has a live-in partner. He lives with her and their two children in the village of Patacón, district of  Pomahuaca, located in the Jaen Province, Cajamarca region, in the north Andes of Peru. Life in this community is quiet. The inhabitants work mainly in commerce and raising small cattle. Pedro provides transportation services via motorcycle taxi and has done so for 3 years. He has experience in this area and very good personal and work references in the region. Also, he offers services of agriculture jobs such as plowing, tilling rice fields using his own two oxen. He works in these activities in the village of Patacon and nearby villages. He will use the loan to repair and maintain his vehicle, because it is currently in bad state. With this, Pedro hopes to offer a better service to his customers which will generate more income, and therefore improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en: Leny is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, including shampoo and groceries. Leny has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for two years. She also earns additional income by buying and selling live fish. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, including shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, including canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar. She also industriously works to earn additional income through other business ventures. Luzviminda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store, including canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: María de 32 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 12 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando actualmente. María posee un puesto en su casa de habitación en el que vende panes con aguacate, queso, jamón, mayonesa y lechuga y de esta forma se gana la vida honradamente, por lo que está orgullosa de su labor  y siempre trata que su producto sea de la mejor calidad para toda su clientela que día con día ha ido creciendo. María es una mujer dedicado a su labor pero sobre todo a su hogar, pues sabe que su familia es muy importante y que siempre merecen lo mejor, es por ello que desde hace ya algún tiempo María tiene el objetivo de construir un cuarto de habitación para brindar a su hijos una mejor calidad de vida  pero no cuenta con el capital para poder realizar la construcción por eso ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en ladrillo, arena, cemento y lamina para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación y a la vez  darle a su familia una vivienda más digna.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and lives together with her partner and her 12 year old daughter, who is currently studying. Maria has a stall in her house from where she sells breads with avocado, cheese, ham, mayonnaise and lettuce. This allows her to make an honest living which makes her proud of her work. She always makes sure her products are of the best quality for all her clients, which are increasing each day.  

Maria is committed to her work but above all to her home as she knows that her family is very important and that they always deserve the best.  Due to this she has, for some time, had the goal of building a bedroom to give her children a better quality of life. However, she doesn't have the resources to be able to carry out the construction. 

She has therefore decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy in bricks, sand, cement and sheet metal in order to build the bedroom and give her family a better home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement and sheet metal in order to build a bedroom and give her family a better home.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 25-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband with no children.  In 2013, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own home business as a tailor.  Her husband represents the main income source of the family. 

Today, Rana is asking to borrow a loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase an electric sewing machine to better improve her business and therefore her revenue.  In the future, she plans to open her own tailoring shop in order to attract more clients.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Talalata Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Talalata está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por Alba de 41 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos por los que trabaja día a día para darles un mejor futuro, ella se dedica a la venta de fritanga y tortilla desde hace ocho años, una de sus metas es aumentar la oferta de comida por esta razón solicita el crédito para comprar; maíz leña, carne de cerdo, repollo, tomate y plátano. La segunda socia es Xiomara de 38 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de carne y la tercer socia es Ana de 19 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The "Talalata" group has three enterprising women as members, of whom 41-year-old Alba is the coordinator. Alba has a partner and is a mother to three children for whom she works every day in order to give them a better future.

Alba has been making a living selling fried snacks and tortillas for eight years. One of her goals is to offer more foods and Alba is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy corn, firewood, pork, cabbage, tomatoes and plantains.

The second member of this group is 38-year-old Xiomara, who works selling meat, and Ana, 19 years old, who makes a living selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, pork, cabbage, tomatoes and plantains.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is a 27-year-old woman living in the Ararat region of Armenia with her husband, two kids, and mother-in-law.  The only source of income for the family is the small income earned by Ani and her husband, working as clothing sellers from their home. 

Ani requested loan from SEF.  Her loan request was approved in the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF.  The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

With the received credit she plans to purchase clothing from wholesalers and resell the goods locally in her town to increase the income of the family.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of clothing to resell to customers.

loans.name: Edis Lucia

texts.es:
Edis, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la prestación de servicios en una escuela, tienen un hijo y en su casa viven cuatro personas, dos sobrinas y su hijo.

Edis, es comerciante desde hace 12 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos en el mismo municipio donde vive, el negocio lo aprendió sola ya que no estudio y esa fue una forma de cómo salir adelante y aportar en el hogar; el negocio lo atiende todos los días vendiendo casa por casa sus productos, camina alrededor de 8 kilómetros al día y su horario de atención es de 5 horas al día. 

Edis, necesita el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad como jabón, detergente, papel higiénico, arroz y frijoles para vender; con este préstamo podrá fortalecer su negocio y con las ganancias cubrirá algunas necesidades de su hijo.

Sus sueños son, tener su negocio bien surtido, que su hijo crezca en un ambiente sano, estudie y alcance sus sueños.
texts.en:
Edis, 37 years old, studied up to the sixth grade. She is married and her husband makes a living by providing services at a school. They have a son and four people live in their house, two cousins and her son.

Edis has been a saleswoman for 12 years now. She makes a living from the sale of clothing and cosmetics in the same municipality where she lives. She learned this trade by herself, as she did not study. This was a way to get ahead and to support her household. She tends to her business everyday, selling her products door to door. She walks about 8 kilometres everyday for 5 hours.

Edis requires the loan to buy staple products such as soap, detergent, toilet paper, rice and beans to sell. With this loan she will be able to strengthen her business and with her income she will cover some of her son's needs.

Her dreams are to have a well-stocked business, that her son grows up in a healthy environment, studies and achieves his dreams.

loans.use: to buy staple products such as soap, detergent, toilet paper, rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Rawaa

texts.en:
Rawaa is a 45 year old single woman.  Her brother represents the main income source for the family to fulfill their family's needs and meet their demands. 

Today, in order to pay her sister's school fees, she is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.  She said that she is very happy and satisfied to be able to help her sister ensure a suitable educational path for herself.

loans.use: to pay her sister's school fees.

loans.name: Mil Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mil está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por Maria de 38 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace cinco años, solicita por tercer vez el financiamiento e ADIM, con el crédito anterior mejoró su vivienda, esta vez solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, vestidos, blusas y chores, uno de sus proyectos es administrar bien el dinero para lograr poner una tienda en su domicilio. La segunda socia es Lesbia quien se dedica a la elaboración de objetos utilitarios a base de madera, Gabriela es la tercer miembro del grupo quien se dedica a la venta de gaseosa y granos básicos.
texts.en:
The "Mil" loan group has three enterprising women as members, and has 38-year-old María as coordinator. María is married and a mother to two children. She has been making a living selling clothing for five years and is applying for her third loan from ADIM. She used her last loan to make improvements to her home. She is applying for this loan in order to buy trousers, dresses, blouses and shorts. One of María's plans is to manage this money well in order to succeed in opening a shop in her home.

The second member of this group is Lesbia, who makes a living producing wooden household objects. Gabriela is the third member of this group; she makes a living selling fizzy drinks and basic grains.

loans.use: to buy trousers, dresses, blouses and shorts.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Mwamvua is a business mother of two grown children, supporting her life with a small business selling fresh juices and cooked food dishes.  She cooks a variety of dishes including, bagia, vitumbua, chapati, local bread (mkate wa kumimina) and kachori dishes. She works really hard.  Mwamvua is 58 years old and a widow.  She works from 7am  4pm daily and is able to make a fair profit each day. 

Mwamvua is from Tujijenge, Tanzania, and this is her third loan.  All of the previous loans have been repaid successfully.  She used the previous loans to buy ingredients for the food dishs and fruits for making juices, managing to earn extra income, which she used to cover her living costs.  Mwamvua dreams of being successful with her business and of building a small house for herself since she is currently renting. 

With her new credit request, she will buy charcoal, baking flour, cooking oil, sugar, and Irish potatoes for her food dish sales business.  Mwamvua will share this loan with her group, Bega Kwa Bega, which consists of two women, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, baking flour, cooking oil, sugar, and Irish potatoes for her cooked food dish sales business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like through pre-paid mobile services.

Evangeline dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Las Doradas Group

texts.es: El grupo las Doradas está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras, coordinado por Dania de 38 años de edad madre de dos hijos, pero solo uno a su cargo, ella es una mujer laboriosa de buenos valores y con muchos deseos de superación, propietaria de una tienda de variedades, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pantalones, blusas, toallas y zapatos, solicitan por octavo ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM, con el crédito anterior logro comprar un carrito sandwichero, la segunda socia es doña mariana de 60 años, quien es propietaria de una pulpería, la tercer socia es Claudia de 32 años de edad quien es propietaria de una escuela de danza desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The group Las Doradas is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women. The group is coordinated by Dania, who is 38 years old and the mother of two children. Only one of her children is still under her care. Dania is a hardworking woman with good values, and a lot of desire to improve herself. She is the owner of a convenience store, and she is requesting the loan to buy pants, blouses, towels and shoes.

This requested loan is the eighth cycle for the group with ADIM. With the previous loan, the group managed to buy a sandwich cart. The second member is Doña Mariana, who is 60 years old and owner of a grocery store. The third member is Claudia, who is 32 years old and has been the owner of a dance school for four years.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, towels and shoes.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 51-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband and her three children, two of them are still studying. 

She works very hard in producing homemade food and also works as a housekeeper.  Her the aim is to satisfy her living needs and to help her husband. 

She started her business in 2005 and she is very talented at it and prepares delicious provisions. Today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l in order to purchase food and raw materials that she intends to use to increase her productivity, and hence her income.

loans.use: to purchase food and raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 30-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children, both of whom are attending school. She and her husband cooperate to keep their respectable standard of living. 

She has owned a beauty salon since 2013, where she provides customers with beauty services such as hairdressing, make up, etc.

Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l in order to purchase more beauty products. 

She plans to improve her business and income by offering her clients with the highest quality services possible.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products.
